analyzed: de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir dper na sa la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas don dam par gzugs rang gi rgyu dag las gzhan ma yin par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang don dam par bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Just as form is not ultimately different from its own component parts, because if one does not apprehend them, one does not have the cognition of it, like the self of earth and so on, so too here, ultimately vases and cloth and so on are not different from their own component parts,

original: 'jim pa dang rgyu spun la sogs pa ma bzung na bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i blo med pa'i phyir dper na 'jim pa dang rgyu /

original: spun la sogs pa rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas don dam par bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag rang gi rgyu dag las gzhan ma yin par ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //

translated: Thus, the meaning of the reason â€œbecause they are included in the aggregatesâ€ is not established, and so on. This is the conclusion, and the result of the proof.

analyzed: phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma grub pa nyid do //

translated: And there is no example. How so?

original: tshig gi don snga ma bzhin no //ğŸ”½de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /ğŸ”½stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //ğŸ”½de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs te 'di lta ste /

original: skye mched la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: skye mched la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: The VaibhÄá¹£ikas, etc., maintain that the sense-spheres, etc., exist by virtue of own-being.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos sa la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i gtan tshigs su mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos sa la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i gtan tshigs su mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa dag yin no //
translated: The particularity of that, i.e., the particularity of the opponentâ€™s reason for demonstrating the existence of earth, etc., is stated to be â€œbecause of the existence of the defining characteristic.â€

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The negation of that, i.e., the negation of that particularity of the counter-correlate by means of emptiness, is the basis for the undertaking of the fifth chapter.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas khams rnams dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas khams rnams dngos po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the following text is to be connected with this, i.e., the meaning of the following text is to be connected with the words â€œthe five chapters are undertaken in order to demonstrate the non-existence of the elements by way of own-being.â€

original: khams rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: khams rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The demonstration of the non-existence of the elements by way of own-being is the result of this chapter.

original: rab tu byed pa bstan ma thag par /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bstan ma thag par /
translated: The treatise that was just presented says:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from what is called form,

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
translated: the cause of form is not seen.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phung po brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bstan @62a * //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phung po brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bstan @62a * //
translated: The treatise that was just presented, the chapter on the aggregates, explains this.

original: ma thag par bstan bcos mdzad pas de skad ces bshad pa'i phyir rang gi sde pa dag gis de ni mi bzod pas de'i phyir re zhig rang gi sde pa dag na re 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma thag par bstan bcos mdzad pas de skad ces bshad pa'i phyir rang gi sde pa dag gis de ni mi bzod pas de'i phyir re zhig rang gi sde pa dag na re 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since the Vaibhasikas cannot accept this, they say, â€œOur schools say this.â€ğŸ”½The Bhagavan said, â€œGreat King, these six elements are a person.â€

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pas zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan dag gi gzhung las de skad ces gsungs pas khams drug po sa dang / chu dang me dang rlung dang /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pas zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan dag gi gzhung las de skad ces gsungs pas khams drug po sa dang / chu dang me dang rlung dang /
translated: This is stated in the scriptures of other schools. The six elements are earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness.

original: nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dag gi mtshan nyid sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang / g-yo ba dang / skabs 'byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa dag ston to zhes bya ba ni khams drug po dag gi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid yod par dam 'cha' ba yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dag gi mtshan nyid sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang / g-yo ba dang / skabs 'byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa dag ston to zhes bya ba ni khams drug po dag gi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid yod par dam 'cha' ba yin no //
translated: The characteristics of the so-called space and consciousness are revealed as solidity, fluidity, heat, mobility, the quality of providing room, and the quality of being conscious.

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa lta bu med pa dag ni skyes bu'i rgyu nyid du ma bstan pas zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa lta bu med pa dag ni skyes bu'i rgyu nyid du ma bstan pas zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
translated: The non-existent, such as the sky-flower, etc., are not taught to be the cause of a person.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis sa la sogs pa dag la yang gzugs kyi rgyu med do zhes dam bca' ba byas pa de ni khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis sa la sogs pa dag la yang gzugs kyi rgyu med do zhes dam bca' ba byas pa de ni khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: Therefore, the masterâ€™s thesis that â€œform does not have a cause in earth, etc.,â€ is contradicted by his own assertion.ğŸ”½The author of the treatise says:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from what is called form,

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
translated: The cause of form is not seen.

original: zhes dam bca' ba byas pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pa'i lung khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes dam bca' ba byas pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pa'i lung khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The Sautrantikas say: The statement â€œThe six elements are the personâ€ is a scriptural source that contradicts your thesis.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas tha snyad du khams drug po dag skyes bu'o zhes bstan par khas blangs pas nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag na re gal te khyed dbu ma pa na re /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas tha snyad du khams drug po dag skyes bu'o zhes bstan par khas blangs pas nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag na re gal te khyed dbu ma pa na re /
translated: If you accept that the Tathagata taught conventionally that the six elements are the person, there is no fault.ğŸ”½If you say that, then you accept that the Tathagata taught conventional truth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob kyi bden par de skad bstan par nged dbu ma pas khas blangs pas nged cag la khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'iğŸ”½nyes pa med do zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob kyi bden par de skad bstan par nged dbu ma pas khas blangs pas nged cag la khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'iğŸ”½nyes pa med do zhes zer na'o //
translated: If you say that the statement â€œThe six elements are the personâ€ is a scriptural source that contradicts our thesis, then you accept that the Tathagata taught conventional truth.

original: don dam par bstan par khas blangs pa'i phyir nyes pa med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nged rang gi sde pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pa'i lung de don dam par
analyzed: don dam par bstan par khas blangs pa'i phyir nyes pa med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nged rang gi sde pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pa'i lung de don dam par
translated: This is not so, because our Buddhist schools accept that the scripture, â€œGreat King, these six elements are the person,â€

original: khas blangs pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa la khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur pa'i nyes pa med @62b pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa la khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur pa'i nyes pa med @62b pa ma yin no //
translated: teaches ultimately. Therefore, you Madhyamikas are not without the fault of contradicting your own assertions.ğŸ”½If you say that it is not a reason because it is not established,

original: gal te de ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te khyed dbu ma pa na re don dam par bstan par khas blangs pa de nged la ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: gal te de ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te khyed dbu ma pa na re don dam par bstan par khas blangs pa de nged la ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer na'o //
translated: if you Madhyamikas say that it is not a reason because the acceptance that it is taught ultimately is not established for us,ğŸ”½it is not the case that it is not established.

original: ma grub pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni khyed dbu ma pa la yang don dam par bstan pa de ma grub pa ma yin te zhes bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni khyed dbu ma pa la yang don dam par bstan pa de ma grub pa ma yin te zhes bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: This is the proof that it is not the case that it is not established for you Madhyamikas that it is taught ultimately.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par sa la sogs pa khams rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir don dam par sa la sogs pa khams rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The elements such as earth exist ultimately,

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their characteristics exist.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis gang don dam par med do zhes gsungs pa de la ni mtshan nyid med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //ğŸ”½sa la sogs pa dag la ni sra ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag yod pas de ltar de dag gi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa khams rnams yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis gang don dam par med do zhes gsungs pa de la ni mtshan nyid med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no // sa la sogs pa dag la ni sra ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag yod pas de ltar de dag gi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa khams rnams yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The Lord Buddha has said that whatever does not exist ultimately has no characteristics, like a sky-flower.ğŸ”½But since the characteristics of solidity, etc., exist in earth, etc., therefore, since their characteristics exist, the elements such as earth exist.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The elements are the subject, the probandum is the property, the proof is the property of the probandum, the example is the dissimilar class, the application is the application, and the conclusion is the conclusion.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of this commentary explains:

original: de la 'dir nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis bstan sla ba'i phyir dang / de yod pa ma yin par bstan pas khams lhag ma rnams dgag pa yang sla ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis nam mkha'i khams kho na'i dbang du mdzad de bshad pa /
analyzed: de la 'dir nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis bstan sla ba'i phyir dang / de yod pa ma yin par bstan pas khams lhag ma rnams dgag pa yang sla ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis nam mkha'i khams kho na'i dbang du mdzad de bshad pa /
translated: Here, because the nature of space is easy to teach with emptiness, and because the remaining elements are easy to refute by teaching that they do not exist, the Master explains in terms of the element of space alone.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
translated: Prior to the characteristics of space,

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: space does not exist in the least.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: and so on.

original: dbyer med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni gal te dbyer yod na ni snga phyi yang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid la ni dbyer med pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis de las dgongs nas
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni gal te dbyer yod na ni snga phyi yang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid la ni dbyer med pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis de las dgongs nas
translated: The meaning is that if there were differentiation, then priority and posteriority would exist, but because the basis of the characteristics of space and its characteristics are not differentiated, the Master intended that.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na nam mkha' cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na nam mkha' cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //

translated: In order to demonstrate that they are not different, the VaibhÄá¹£ikas say, Space is just nonobstruction, and nonobstruction is space.

translated: Since the VaibhÄá¹£ika Å›rÄvakas say that the characteristic of space is nonobstruction, nonobstruction and space are not different and are inseparable.ğŸ”½They establish that space exists.

translated: For example, it is like saying, Sound is impermanent because it is impermanent.ğŸ”½In the same way, here it is said, Space exists because space exists.ğŸ”½For example, it is like saying, Sound is impermanent because it is impermanent.

analyzed: dper na sgra ni mi rtag ste mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pas mi 'grub pa de bzhin du bye brag tu smra ba dag gis nam mkha' yod de nam mkha' yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba

translated: Our own schools who are hostile to the way of the Madhyamaka treatise and who assert that the elements exist substantially say, â€œYou

translated: if the opponent says, â€œThe space that exists conventionally is renowned as having the characteristic of nonobstructiveness even by you MÄdhyamikas.

translated: Since we also accept that, therefore the reason, the nonobstructive nature that is renowned as the characteristic of conventionally existent space, proves that space exists ultimately.â€

translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary here says, â€œWe do not assert that reason,â€ in order to demonstrate that.

translated: The opponent says: You MÄdhyamikas say that space is renowned conventionally as nonobstructiveness, so it exists conventionally.

translated: Since in the Madhyamaka ultimate space is not renowned as existing as nonobstruction, we assert that the definition of space as nonobstruction is renowned conventionally.

analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de la yang gtan tshigs kyi skyon dang dpe'i skyon yod de dam bcas pa tsam la gnas par zad do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, â€œIn that case, the reason is faulty and the example is faulty, and it is just a thesis.â€

original: kun rdzob tu mi sgrib pa nyid yin par grags pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par nam mkha' yod pa nyid du sgrub pa ni gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu mi sgrib pa nyid yin par grags pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par nam mkha' yod pa nyid du sgrub pa ni gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: The reason that space is renowned conventionally as nonobstructive does not prove that space exists ultimately, because the meaning of the reason is contradictory.

original: dpe med pa'i skyon yang yod de don dam par nam mkha' yod par bsgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i skyon yang yod de don dam par nam mkha' yod par bsgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe 'ga' yang med de /

analyzed: don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimately no thing whatsoever is established as existent.

original: de'i phyir pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa de ni dam bcas pa tsam la gnas par zad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa de ni dam bcas pa tsam la gnas par zad de /

analyzed: gtan tshigs dang dpe med pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang na bye brag tu smra ba dang bye brag pa dag nam mkha' ni rdzas su yod pa dang 'dus ma byas so zhes zer bas de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: yang na bye brag tu smra ba dang bye brag pa dag nam mkha' ni rdzas su yod pa dang 'dus ma byas so zhes zer bas de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Again, because the VaibhÄá¹£ikas and the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas say that space is substantially existent and unconditioned, this is explained for them.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
translated: Prior to the characteristics of space,

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: space does not exist in the least.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dang / mu stegs bye brag pa dag nam mkha' ni rdzas su yod pa dang / 'dus ma byas so zhes zer bas de dag dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba dang / mu stegs bye brag pa dag nam mkha' ni rdzas su yod pa dang / 'dus ma byas so zhes zer bas de dag dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the VaibhÄá¹£ika Å›rÄvakas and the tÄ«rthika VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas say that space is substantially existent and unconditioned.

original: slob dpon gyis tshig le'ur byas pa'i byed gong ma 'di yang rnam pa gzhan du bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis tshig le'ur byas pa'i byed gong ma 'di yang rnam pa gzhan du bshad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: rdzas su gyur pa'o zhes dam bca' ba nye bar bzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The assertion that it is substantially existent is presented as a thesis.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
translated: Before the characteristics of space

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: not the slightest space exists.

translated: What is the meaning of this?ğŸ”½The assertion that before the characteristics of space, not the slightest space that is substantially existent exists is presented as a thesis.

analyzed: de skye ba med par phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa ni chos yin no zhes bya ba ni /

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //

translated: The property that proves that thesis, the reason, is renowned to both parties in the debate as the nonarising of space.

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis de //
analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis de //
translated: The example is taught by the power of that.ğŸ”½The horns of a rabbit and so on are the example.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na nam mkha' rdzas su gyur pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes dam bca' @65a * //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na nam mkha' rdzas su gyur pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes dam bca' @65a * //
translated: Prior to the characteristic of space, space does not exist in the least as a substance.

translated: The horns of a rabbit and so on are not substantially existent, and the non-arising of the established property and the proving property are acknowledged by both parties.

analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nam mkha' rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /

translated: So too, you should state arguments such as â€œbecause it has no cause,â€ â€œbecause it has no effect,â€ and â€œbecause it does not exist.â€

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
translated: Prior to the characteristics of space,

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //

translated: The argument for that position should be stated as â€œbecause it has no cause,â€ â€œbecause it has no effect,â€ â€œbecause it does not exist,â€ and so on.

translated: Also, those who say that space is the characteristic of sound are similar to the previous faulty reason because sound itself is space.ğŸ”½SÄá¹ƒkhyas say that space arises from sound alone, therefore space is the characteristic of sound and it substantially exists.

original: nam mkha' yod pa nyid de nam mkha' yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / sgra yod pa nyid de sgra yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bur dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma 'grub par snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' yod pa nyid de nam mkha' yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / sgra yod pa nyid de sgra yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bur dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma 'grub par snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Also, for them sound itself is space, therefore, because cause and effect are similar, the faulty reason is similar to the previous one.ğŸ”½Also, because the meaning of the thesis is one part of the reason, the meaning of the reason is not established, as before.

analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin // zhes smras pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba 'dir 'grel pa byed pas nam mkha'i mtshan nyid dang nam mkha' gzhan nyid ma yin par bsgrubs te bshad pa de la bye brag pa'i 'grel pa byed pa dag na re khyed kyi nam mkha'i mtshan
translated: Space is not in the slightest wayğŸ”½different from the characteristics of space.ğŸ”½Here, the author of the commentary proves that the characteristics of space and space are not different, and he explains this.

translated: The authors of the VaibhÄá¹£ika commentary say: This meaning that you prove and explain that the characteristics of space and space are not different is not the intention of the treatise author, the venerable NÄgÄrjuna.

translated: He said:

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //

translated: Thus he taught only that the characteristics of space and space cannot be sequential. Therefore you say that the meaning of this explanation, which is not the characteristics of space, is not the intention of the treatise author.

translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says that since the refutation of difference is established by merely teaching that earlier and later are impossible, that is not a fault.

analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas gzhan nyid dgag pa'i thabs kho nar snga phyi mi srid par bstan pa yin pas bstan bcos mdzad pas snga phyi mi srid par bstan pa kho nas gzhan nyid dgag pa 'grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi klan ka de ni kho bo la mi gnod
translated: Since the treatise author teaches that earlier and later are impossible as the very method to refute difference, since the treatise author establishes the refutation of difference by merely teaching that earlier and later are impossible, your criticism does not fault us.ğŸ”½If one asks, how is the refutation of difference established by merely teaching that earlier and later are impossible?

translated: Since the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas assert that the basis of the characteristics and the characteristics are different,

analyzed: bye brag pa dag mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag @66a * //
translated: The VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas assert that the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics are different.ğŸ”½In order to refute their difference, the master NÄgÄrjuna taught this second half of the verse.

translated: The refutation of their difference is established merely by demonstrating that the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics cannot be sequential.ğŸ”½The method of establishing the valid knowledge that refutes their difference merely by demonstrating that they cannot be sequential is as follows.

translated: If they were different, it would follow that they would be sequential.

translated: Because they are different, like a vase and a cloth.

translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.ğŸ”½For example, because a vase and a cloth are different, they sometimes occur earlier and sometimes later.

analyzed: dper na bum pa dang snam bu dag ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir lan 'ga' snga phyir yang 'gyur ba de bzhin du bye brag pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag gzhan nyid du dam 'cha' ba yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir lan 'ga' snga phyir
translated: In the same way, because the Vaise~ika's basis of characteristics and characteristics are also different, they would sometimes occur earlier and sometimes later.ğŸ”½But if the basis of characteristics were to occur earlier than the characteristics, the error of the basis of characteristics being without characteristics would arise.

translated: Some say: The basis of those characteristics, space, definitely exists,ğŸ”½because its characteristics engage.ğŸ”½Those who say this, such as Vaibhasikas, assert that the basis of those characteristics exists through the engagement of characteristics.ğŸ”½Their inference is that the basis of those characteristics, the object characterized, the property of the thesis, the example and so on are respectively

translated: Since there is no existent thing whatsoever that is without a characteristic, and since there is no basis for the application of a characteristic, it is untenable to state that a characteristic is applied to a basis.

analyzed: gzhi med pa'i phyir gzhi bzhin du gtan tshigs mi 'grub ste zhes bya ba ste /

translated: Since there is no existent thing without a characteristic,

analyzed: mtshan nyid gang du 'jug par 'gyur //

translated: Since there is no existent thing that is the basis of a characteristic and that is without a characteristic, the reason â€œbecause a characteristic is applied to itâ€ is not established, just like the basis.

original: yang na gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyogs la ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid yin na de gnyis gyis de mtshon par byar mi rung ste /

translated: The VaibhÄá¹£ikas say that since space is taught to be nonobstructive alone, the basis and its characteristics are not different.

translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi phyogs la yang smra bar 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: If you assert that the characteristic and the basis of the characteristic are different, then the characteristic of the basis of the characteristic is not the characteristic of the basis of the characteristic.ğŸ”½This is because they are different, like anything else that is different from it.ğŸ”½This is the meaning of the above passage.

translated: If you assert that the basis of the characteristic and the characteristic are different, then because the characteristic does not apply to the basis of the characteristic, the basis of the characteristic would be without a characteristic.ğŸ”½And if it is without a characteristic, then it would not be the basis of the characteristic.

analyzed: mtshan nyid gang du 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: where would the characteristic apply?

original: zhes bya ba'i don de 'byung bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don de 'byung bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: de dag gi rjes su dpag pa de yang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /ğŸ”½dper na nam mkha'i mtshan nyid mi sgrib pa de las gzhan pas la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sra ba la sogs pa dag ni nam mkha' las gzhan yin pa'i phyir de dag nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyis gzhan nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du pha
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su dpag pa de yang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na nam mkha'i mtshan nyid mi sgrib pa de las gzhan pas la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sra ba la sogs pa dag ni nam mkha' las gzhan yin pa'i phyir de dag nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyis gzhan nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du pha
translated: After that, the inference is applied to the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example, respectively.ğŸ”½For example, the characteristic of space is nonobstructiveness. The characteristics of others, such as solidity, are different from space, and therefore they are not the characteristic of space.

translated: In the same way, the characteristic of space that you, the opponent, wish to state, nonobstructiveness, is different from space, and therefore it is not the characteristic of space.

translated: Because it is added to that, it is not a characteristic. Therefore, space does not have a characteristic.

analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po nam mkha' zhes bya ba med na /

analyzed: de 'jug pa mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras te / de dag kyang sngar pha rol po dag na re mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nam mkha' ni yod pa kho na yin te /

analyzed: de la mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the reason â€œbecause the characteristic is posited in the basis of the characteristicâ€ was previously explained as follows:ğŸ”½The meaning of the reason â€œbecause the characteristic is posited in the basis of the characteristicâ€ is this: If the existence of the phenomenon that is the basis of the characteristic, such as space, does not exist, the characteristic does not occur.

original: gzhan yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ni 'di la mtshan nyid 'di mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos yod pa nyid la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba des mtshan nyid kyi gzhi shes par 'gyur ba yin na zhes byağŸ”½ba ni sngar pha rol po dag na re mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nam mkha' ni yod pa kho na yin te /

translated: Moreover, the meaning of the reason â€œbecause the characteristic is posited in the basis of the characteristicâ€ is this: If the existence of the phenomenon that is the basis of the characteristic, such as space, does not exist, the characteristic does not occur.

original: de la mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di la mtshan nyid mi sgrib pa zhes bya ba 'di mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos nam mkha' yod pa nyid la sogs pa dang med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa'i sgo de nas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi shes par 'gyur ba yin na mtshan nyid kyis
translated: Here, the meaning of the statement â€œa characteristic does not obscureâ€ is that the basis of a characteristic, such as the existence of space, is known through the door of the relation of invariable concomitance.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi shes par 'gyur ba de yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi shes par 'gyur ba de yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: However, it is untenable that the basis of a characteristic is known through a characteristic.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'thad ce na /

analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe kho bo cag gi phyogs la / mtshan nyid med la mtshan nyid ni //
translated: Therefore, when we analyze our own position,ğŸ”½a characteristic is not engaged

original: mi 'jug mtshan nyid bcas la @69a * //
analyzed: mi 'jug mtshan nyid bcas la @69a * //
translated: in that which lacks a characteristic.

original: min / de'i tshe med pa la ni mtshan nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: min / de'i tshe med pa la ni mtshan nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: No, because at that time, the characteristic would not be established in the absence of the basis, and also because an entity possessing a characteristic would not be established.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la ni mtshan nyid mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la ni mtshan nyid mi 'jug ste /
translated: The characteristic does not apply to a basis of the characteristic that is without a characteristic.

original: gang gi tshe mtshan nyid med pa de'i tshe de la mtshan nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la mtshan nyid mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mtshan nyid med pa de'i tshe de la mtshan nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la mtshan nyid mi 'jug go //
translated: When it is without a characteristic, at that time the characteristic is not established in it, therefore the characteristic does not apply to a basis of the characteristic that is without a characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la yang mtshan nyid mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la yang mtshan nyid mi 'jug ste /

analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po nam mkha' zhes bya ba zhig don dam par grub par gyur na ni de la mtshan nyid 'jug par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de mi 'grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la yang mi 'jug go zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If a thing called space that possesses characteristics were ultimately established, then its characteristics would also apply to it. But since that is not established, it is the thought that the characteristics do not apply to a basis that possesses characteristics.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½mtshan bcas mtshan nyid med pa las //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir / mtshan bcas mtshan nyid med pa las //
translated: Since a basis that possesses characteristics that is dissimilar to the characteristics that were just explained is not established,ğŸ”½The characteristics do not apply

original: gzhan la'ang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la'ang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: To anything other than that which possesses or lacks characteristics.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa'i rnam pa sngar ci skad bstan pa dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa'i rnam pa sngar ci skad bstan pa dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yang yin la /
translated: That which possesses characteristics and that which lacks characteristics are as they were previously explained. A basis that possesses characteristics that is dissimilar to the characteristics that were just explained is not established.

original: mtshan nyid med pa yin pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa yin pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can zhig yin grang na /
translated: If it were both,

analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni mi 'grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the basis of those characteristics would not be established, and the characteristics would not apply to a basis of those characteristics that is other than that which possesses characteristics and that which lacks characteristics.

original: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par dngos po 'ga' la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir khyod kyi 'dod pa'i don ma grub po zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par dngos po 'ga' la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe med pa'i phyir khyod kyi 'dod pa'i don ma grub po zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, since in that way, ultimately, the characteristics do not apply to any thing at all, and since there is no example, the object of your assertion is not established. This is the conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa dang de gnyis las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir khyod kyi 'dod pa'i don mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nam mkha' ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa dang de gnyis las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir khyod kyi 'dod pa'i don mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nam mkha' ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: As such, since the characteristic is not established to apply to a basis of the characteristic that is both with and without a characteristic, or other than those two, and since there is no example of the application of a characteristic, the basis of the characteristic, space, which is asserted by you, does exist,

original: de la mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ma grub po //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ma grub po //
translated: because the characteristic applies to it.

original: yang na mtshan nyid med pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa dag la mtshan nyid @69b de med pa'i phyir mi 'jug pa de ni grags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½mtshan nyid med la mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: yang na mtshan nyid med pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa dag la mtshan nyid @69b de med pa'i phyir mi 'jug pa de ni grags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni / mtshan nyid med la mtshan nyid ni //
translated: Or, it is well known that the characteristic does not apply to that which lacks a characteristic, such as the sky flower, because it does not exist.

original: mi 'jug / ces bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don ni 'jig rten thams cad la yang grags pa yin pas 'dir tshad mas sgrub mi dgos so //
analyzed: mi 'jug / ces bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don ni 'jig rten thams cad la yang grags pa yin pas 'dir tshad mas sgrub mi dgos so //
translated: The meaning of the verse â€œThe characteristic does not apply to that which lacks a characteristicâ€ is well known to everyone. Therefore it is not necessary to prove it with a valid cognition here.

original: da ni mtshan nyid bcas la min //
analyzed: da ni mtshan nyid bcas la min //
translated: Now, it does not apply to that which possesses a characteristic.

original: zhes bya ba mtshan nyid dang bcas pa la mtshan nyid mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i skabs de ni dam bca' nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa'i tshad ma ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba mtshan nyid dang bcas pa la mtshan nyid mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i skabs de ni dam bca' nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa'i tshad ma ston te /
translated: The passage â€œThe characteristic does not apply to that which has the characteristicâ€ is the statement of the thesis.

original: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa la mtshan nyid mi 'jug go zhes bya ba de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa la mtshan nyid mi 'jug go zhes bya ba de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is explained in another way: â€œThe characteristic does not apply to that which has the characteristicâ€ is the statement of the thesis.

translated: The example is â€œby the power of that.â€

translated: For example, thinness and so on are not characteristics of space because they are characteristics, just as thinness and so on are not characteristics of space because they are characteristics.

analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa yang yin pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir ro //

translated: In that regard, the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita explains that since there is no entity without a characteristic, therefore, if there were no entity without a characteristic, it would not be tenable for a characteristic to be instantiated in a nonexistent basis.

translated: In that case, it would not be contradictory for a characteristic to be applied to a basis of characteristic in order to remind some other person who has forgotten what the characteristic of a basis of characteristic is, because it is taught, â€œThe characteristic of this basis of characteristic is this.â€ğŸ”½But that also is not logical.

translated: But if prior to the production of sound, sound does not exist, and it exists later, then the meaning of the reason is not established.ğŸ”½The statement that the meaning of the reason is not established is correct, because the statement â€œSound is impermanent because it is producedâ€ is a reason that causes understanding, and it is a reason that has the nature of words and the nature of objects.

original: de la tshig gi bdag nyid ni byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi gtan tshigs kyis sgra mi rtag pa nyid du shes pa'i blo sgrub par byed pas de yang ma grub pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: de la tshig gi bdag nyid ni byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi gtan tshigs kyis sgra mi rtag pa nyid du shes pa'i blo sgrub par byed pas de yang ma grub pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: The reason that has the nature of words is the words â€œbecause it is produced.â€ The reason that has the nature of objects is the quality of being produced.ğŸ”½The reason that has the nature of words establishes the cognition that sound is impermanent, and it is not the case that it is not established.

original: don gyi bdag nyid ni byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma brjod pa'i mdun rol na yang sgra la byas pa nyid kyi don yod pa yin pas de yang ma grub pa nyid ma yin pa las de la gang dag gal te sgra skyes pa'i
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid ni byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma brjod pa'i mdun rol na yang sgra la byas pa nyid kyi don yod pa yin pas de yang ma grub pa nyid ma yin pa las de la gang dag gal te sgra skyes pa'i
translated: The meaning of the self is because of being produced.ğŸ”½Even before the reason is stated, the meaning of being produced exists in sound, so it is not the case that it is not established.

original: sngon rol na byas pa nyid yod na ni sgra la 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sngon rol na byas pa nyid yod na ni sgra la 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
translated: If being produced existed prior to the arising of sound, then because of the existence of error in sound, it is not suitable as a reason.ğŸ”½But if being produced did not exist prior to the arising of sound and then existed later, the meaning of the reason would not be established.

original: 'on te sgra skyes pa'i snga rol na byas pa nyid med de phyis yod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ba de'i tshig de rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa ni bden no //
analyzed: 'on te sgra skyes pa'i snga rol na byas pa nyid med de phyis yod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ba de'i tshig de rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa ni bden no //
translated: If you say that, then it is true that your words are not reasonable.

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs mtshan nyid kyi sngon rol na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ltar rigs pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs mtshan nyid kyi sngon rol na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ltar rigs pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: But we Followers of the Middle Way do not say, â€œThe reason is not established because the basis of the reason does not exist prior to the reasonâ€™s properties.â€ğŸ”½We do not say such unreasonable things.

original: legs pa yin pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: legs pa yin pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, your reason, â€œbecause the definition of a reason exists,â€ is not established.

original: de ltar mkhas su re ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de dag dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa brgyad pa las 'byung ba'i lan tsam yang 'debs mi nus bzhin du dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma lta bu la ltag chod du rgol bar byed
analyzed: de ltar mkhas su re ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de dag dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa brgyad pa las 'byung ba'i lan tsam yang 'debs mi nus bzhin du dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma lta bu la ltag chod du rgol bar byed
translated: Thus, those who are arrogant, hoping to be scholars, are unable to even respond to the response that occurs in the eighth chapter of the Root Verses on the Middle Way, and they argue perversely against the Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on the Root Verses on the Middle Way.

original: pa de dag gis ni bdag nyid rigs pa'i sgo tsam yang mi shes par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa de dag gis ni bdag nyid rigs pa'i sgo tsam yang mi shes par bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are teaching that they do not even understand the mere door of reasoning.
