analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid gang la gzhan nyid kyang yin la med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yang med pa dper na nam mkha' dang sra ba nyid lta bu ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir sra ba nyid gang yin ba de
translated: The meaning of the reason is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the reason is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the reason is not established.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas sra ba nyid ces bya ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin ba de nam mkha' yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin gyi mi sgrib pa dang nam mkha' lta bu gang la gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang med na mi 'byung ba'iğŸ”½mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yod pa de ni gzhan yin yang mi sgrib pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nam mkha' yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin pas des na mi sgrib pa dang nam mkha' gzhan yang yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas sra ba nyid ces bya ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin ba de nam mkha' yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin gyi mi sgrib pa dang nam mkha' lta bu gang la gzhan nyid yin du zin kyang med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yod pa de ni gzhan yin yang mi sgrib pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nam mkha' yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin pas des na mi sgrib pa dang nam mkha' gzhan yang yin la /
translated: Therefore, since nonobstruction and space are different, and since nonobstruction is the characteristic of space, the meaning of our reason is that the characteristic exists.

original: mi sgrib pa de nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pas kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs kyi don mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid du brjod pa yang ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mi sgrib pa de nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pas kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs kyi don mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid du brjod pa yang ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: You Followers of the Middle Way say that our reason is not established, but it is not.

original: ma grub pa ltar snang ba nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa ltar snang ba nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But it is not established as the meaning of the reason.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni bzang po ma yin te don dam par gzhan nyid dang med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa ma grub pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni bzang po ma yin te don dam par gzhan nyid dang med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa ma grub pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, â€œThat is not good, because ultimately the connection is not established by the characteristics of otherness and absence of non-arising.â€

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pa ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba nyid ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pa ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba nyid ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: You say that the meaning of the reason is not established, but it is not the case that it is not established as it appears. Why is that?

original: don dam par mi sgrib pa dang nam mkha' gzhan nyid yin par yang ma grub la /
analyzed: don dam par mi sgrib pa dang nam mkha' gzhan nyid yin par yang ma grub la /
translated: Ultimately, non-obstruction and space are not established as other.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel par yang ma grub pas des na gzhan yang yin la med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yang yin pas mi sgrib pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba de mi rung bas de ni
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel par yang ma grub pas des na gzhan yang yin la med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yang yin pas mi sgrib pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba de mi rung bas de ni
translated: And the connection by the characteristic of absence of non-arising is also not established. Therefore, it is not tenable to say that non-obstruction is the characteristic of space because it is other and the connection by the characteristic of absence of non-arising is also established.

original: bzang po ma yin no //ğŸ”½kun rdzob tu ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis @74a * //
analyzed: bzang po ma yin no // kun rdzob tu ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis @74a * //
translated: It is not good.

original: 'brel pa 'gog par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'gog par mi byed de /
translated: In terms of the conventional, we do not refute the relation between the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves, which is characterized by the fact that they do not occur without each other.

original: mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would contradict direct perception.

original: de'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa yang spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa yang spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, we say that we also wish to abandon attachment to that.

original: don dam par gzhan nyid dang med pa mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa de la mngon par zhen pa yang spong bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par gzhan nyid dang med pa mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa de la mngon par zhen pa yang spong bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We also wish to abandon attachment to the relation between the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves, which is characterized by the fact that they do not occur without each other in the ultimate.

original: 'o na mtshan nyid mi sgrib pa des la sogs pa gzhan dag gi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'thad do zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: 'o na mtshan nyid mi sgrib pa des la sogs pa gzhan dag gi mtshan nyid yin par mi 'thad do zhes bshad pas /
translated: Well then, it is not tenable that the characteristic of nonobstruction is the characteristic of space and so on, since you have explained that it is not tenable that one thing is the characteristic of another.

original: 'o na don gyis go ba'i sgo nas kun rdzob tu mi sgrib pa de nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na don gyis go ba'i sgo nas kun rdzob tu mi sgrib pa de nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well then, since it is understood by implication, it is not tenable that nonobstruction is the characteristic of space in the conventional.

original: de'i phyir sgrub pa de tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad dang rjes su mthun pa ni yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub pa de tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad dang rjes su mthun pa ni yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the proof of that is in accordance with convention because it demonstrates a thing that belongs to conventional truth.

original: mi sgrib pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin par sgrub pa de kun rdzob kyi bden par gtogs pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad dang rjes su mthun pa ni yin par khas len pas de'i phyir mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: mi sgrib pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin par sgrub pa de kun rdzob kyi bden par gtogs pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad dang rjes su mthun pa ni yin par khas len pas de'i phyir mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yang med do //
translated: We accept that the proof of nonobstruction as the characteristic of space is in accordance with convention because it demonstrates a thing that belongs to conventional truth. Therefore, there is no fault of contradicting direct perception.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog go zhes bya ba ni zhar la bshad pas chog gis mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag dgag pa'i skabs nyid brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog go zhes bya ba ni zhar la bshad pas chog gis mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag dgag pa'i skabs nyid brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Enough with the digression means that we should now return to the topic of refuting the basis of characteristics and characteristics themselves.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: don dam par nam mkha' yod pa kho na yin te mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par nam mkha' yod pa kho na yin te mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Space definitely exists ultimately because it has characteristics.

original: 'di na gang med pa de ni mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de ni mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: Here, that which does not exist is not asserted to be a characteristic, like, for example, the sky flower.ğŸ”½Space is a characteristic, because it is said, â€œGreat King, these six elements are a person.â€ Therefore, it alone exists.

original: nam mkha' ni mtshan nyid yin te rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir de ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan nyid dgag pa'i dbang du byas te phyogs snga ma dangğŸ”½phyi ma dag rgya cher ston to //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni mtshan nyid yin te rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir de ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan nyid dgag pa'i dbang du byas te phyogs snga ma dang phyi ma dag rgya cher ston to //
translated: In this way, the prior and subsequent positions are extensively taught in terms of the refutation of characteristics.

original: de la 'dir phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa ni khams drug po dag rdzas su yod par smra ba rang gi sde pa dang gzhan dag na re don dam par nam mkha' yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa ni khams drug po dag rdzas su yod par smra ba rang gi sde pa dang gzhan dag na re don dam par nam mkha' yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here, the prior position is posited as follows: Other Buddhist schools and our own schools that propound that the six elements exist as substances say, â€œSpace alone exists ultimately,

original: mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dag gis nam mkha' mtshan nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par yod pa kho nar sgrub ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa dag gis nam mkha' mtshan nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par yod pa kho nar sgrub ste /
translated: because its characteristic exists.â€ In this way, they prove that space exists ultimately by the reason of its being a characteristic.

original: de dag gi sgrub pa'i tshig de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i @74b phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag gi sgrub pa'i tshig de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i @74b phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The words of their proofs are respectively the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason proving that, the example of the dissimilar class and the application of the syllogism and its conclusion.

original: de yang lung las /ğŸ”½bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir khams drug po dag ni mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de yang lung las / bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir khams drug po dag ni mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: A scripture says:

original: skyes bu ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin par gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavat said, â€œO great king, these six elements are the person.â€ Therefore the six elements are the definition and the person is the basis of the definition.ğŸ”½Therefore space is the definition and therefore it alone ultimately exists.

original: des na nam mkha' ni mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer te 'dir de dag gi bsam pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na nam mkha' ni mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer te 'dir de dag gi bsam pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is their intention here?

original: sngar kho bo cag gis nam mkha' de mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid yin pa'i sgo nas yod par bsgrubs pa ma grub tu zin kyang /
analyzed: sngar kho bo cag gis nam mkha' de mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid yin pa'i sgo nas yod par bsgrubs pa ma grub tu zin kyang /
translated: Previously, we have established that space exists as the basis of the definition.

original: da 'dir lung las nam mkha' mtshan nyid yin par gsungs pa'i lung de khyed dbu ma pa yang khas len pas des na mtshan nyid yod pa nyid kyi sgo nas nam mkha' yang yod pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam nas de skad ces zer ba yin
analyzed: da 'dir lung las nam mkha' mtshan nyid yin par gsungs pa'i lung de khyed dbu ma pa yang khas len pas des na mtshan nyid yod pa nyid kyi sgo nas nam mkha' yang yod pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam nas de skad ces zer ba yin
translated: Now, you MÄdhyamikas accept that the sÅ«tras state that space is the definition. Therefore, space is established as existing in terms of having a definition.

original: no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /
analyzed: no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary explains:

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mi 'thad do zhes bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mi 'thad do zhes bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since it has been shown that the basis of the definition is untenable,ğŸ”½therefore

original: mtshan gzhi 'thad pa ma yin na //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi 'thad pa ma yin na //
translated: The basis of the definition is not tenable.

original: mtshan nyid kyang ni yod ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang ni yod ma yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The definition also does not exist.

original: da 'di man chad ni mtshan nyid dgag pa'i sgo nas nam mkha' ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: da 'di man chad ni mtshan nyid dgag pa'i sgo nas nam mkha' ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ston to //
translated: From here onward, space is shown to be essenceless by refuting the definition.

original: 'di skad bstan te dngos por smra ba khyed cag sngar nam mkha' mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du 'dod pa de la kho bos mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mi 'thad par lung dang rigs pas rgya cher bstan zin pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'thad pa ma yin
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te dngos por smra ba khyed cag sngar nam mkha' mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du 'dod pa de la kho bos mtshan nyid kyi gzhi mi 'thad par lung dang rigs pas rgya cher bstan zin pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'thad pa ma yin
translated: This is taught: You proponents of entities previously asserted that space is the basis of the characteristics. I have extensively taught with scriptures and reasonings that it is not tenable as the basis of the characteristics. Therefore the basis of the characteristics is not tenable.

original: na mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: na mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Since that is so, the characteristics also do not exist.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de bzhin du mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de bzhin du mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To demonstrate that, it is said that because the characteristics are included within the basis of the characteristics, they are not established in the same way, and because there is no example.

original: ci ltar don dam par nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du ma grub pas mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de bzhin du mi 'grub ste 'di ltar mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med na mtshan nyid kyang yod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir
analyzed: ci ltar don dam par nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid du ma grub pas mtshan nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de bzhin du mi 'grub ste 'di ltar mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med na mtshan nyid kyang yod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir
translated: Just as in the ultimate truth, space is not established as the basis of the characteristics of space, and the characteristics are not established as belonging to the basis of the characteristics, in the same way, if the basis of the characteristics does not exist, the characteristics also do not exist.

original: ro // yang na don dam par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi skyes bu zhes bya ba mi 'thad pas mtshan nyid nam mkha' @75a * //ğŸ”½yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de bzhin du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: ro // yang na don dam par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi skyes bu zhes bya ba mi 'thad pas mtshan nyid nam mkha' @75a * // yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de bzhin du mi 'grub ste /
translated: Or, in the ultimate truth, the basis of the characteristics, the so-called person, is not tenable, and therefore the characteristics of space are also not tenable.ğŸ”½And if the basis of the characteristics does not exist, the characteristics also do not exist.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med na mtshan nyid kyang yod par mi 'gyur bas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med na mtshan nyid kyang yod par mi 'gyur bas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the meaning of the reason of the opponent is the characteristics, since that is not established, space does not exist.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de dpe yang med pa'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de dpe yang med pa'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Not only is the meaning of the reason not established, but also the example does not exist.ğŸ”½The opponent says, â€œSpace does not exist because the example of the opposite of the predicate of the probandum does not exist.

original: 'di ltar pha rol po dag nam mkha' yod par sgrub pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe 'di na gang med pa de ni mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes zer ba de las bzlog pa chos mthun pa'i
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol po dag nam mkha' yod par sgrub pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe 'di na gang med pa de ni mtshan nyid yin par mi 'dod de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes zer ba de las bzlog pa chos mthun pa'i
translated: For example, it is not asserted that the nonexistence of something in space is a characteristic, like a sky flower.

original: phyogs kyi dpe 'di na gang yod pa de ni mtshan nyid yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: phyogs kyi dpe 'di na gang yod pa de ni mtshan nyid yin par 'dod de /
translated: The example of the opposite of the predicate of the probandum is, â€˜Whatever exists in space is asserted to be a characteristic.â€™ğŸ”½For example, it is like so and so.â€™

original: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe yang med pa'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe yang med pa'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: The SÅ«tra master intends to say, â€˜Space does not exist because the example does not exist.â€™

original: gang gi phyir de ltar shes rab kyis nye bar brtags na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag mi 'thad pa de'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar shes rab kyis nye bar brtags na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag mi 'thad pa de'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: Since the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves are untenable when analyzed with wisdom, the author of the treatise says:

original: de'i phyir mtshan gzhi yod min te //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan gzhi yod min te //
translated: Therefore, the basis of those characteristics does not exist.

original: mtshan nyid yod pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa nyid ma yin //
translated: And the characteristics themselves do not exist.

original: zhes mjug bsdu ba mdzad de zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: zhes mjug bsdu ba mdzad de zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion, and it is the result of the valid cognition.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang de med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang de med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, â€œbecause there is no inference that reveals it and because there is an inference that reveals its nonexistence.â€

original: khyed la ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / kho bo la ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod pa'i phyir nam mkha' ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub po zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: khyed la ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / kho bo la ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod pa'i phyir nam mkha' ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub po zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: He means to say, â€œBecause there is no inference that reveals the existence of the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves, and because there is an inference that reveals the nonexistence of the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves, space is established as natureless.â€

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa /
translated: The VaibhÄá¹£ikas say:

original: nam mkha' ni dngos po yin te yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no yang na snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni dngos po yin te yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no yang na snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Or it is the object of meditative attainment, like consciousness and so on.

original: yang na 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni @75b 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag bdag nyid chos mngon pa'i lo rgyus la mi mkhas bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni @75b 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag bdag nyid chos mngon pa'i lo rgyus la mi mkhas bzhin du /
translated: Or it is unconditioned, like nirvana.ğŸ”½Here Vaibhasikas, who are not learned in the history of Abhidharma, claim that the master did not know the history of Abhidharma.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas chos mngon pa'i lo rgyus mi mkhyen pa skad du zur snyogs byed cing don dam par nam mkha' dngos po yin par sgrub par byed pa yin te de dag gi sgrub pa'i tshig de dag kyang chos can dang ; bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas chos mngon pa'i lo rgyus mi mkhyen pa skad du zur snyogs byed cing don dam par nam mkha' dngos po yin par sgrub par byed pa yin te de dag gi sgrub pa'i tshig de dag kyang chos can dang ; bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
translated: They say that he was proving that ultimately space is a thing, for his words prove that space is a thing, that which possesses the attributes of a thing and that which is the attribute of a thing.

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te dper na gzugs ni rnal 'byor pa dag gzugs kyi yul de la de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te dper na gzugs ni rnal 'byor pa dag gzugs kyi yul de la de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi
translated: The Dharma of practice and the example should be applied in order, for example, just as form is an object of yogis, they completely transcend all aspects of discernment of form and the discernment of obstruction disappears and they do not mentally engage the discernment of multiplicity.ğŸ”½Thus they perfect and abide in the base of infinite space, thinking, Space is infinite.

original: 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba'i phyir gzugs dngos po yin pa de bzhin du nam
analyzed: 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba'i phyir gzugs dngos po yin pa de bzhin du nam
translated: In that way, in order to abandon attachment to that object, form is a thing.

original: mkha' yang rnal 'byor pa dag nam mkha'i yul de la de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: mkha' yang rnal 'byor pa dag nam mkha'i yul de la de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Just as space is an object of yogis, they completely transcend the base of infinite space in all aspects.

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba'i phyir nam mkha' yang dngos po yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba'i phyir nam mkha' yang dngos po yin no zhes zer te /
translated: They say that space is a thing because they abandon attachment to the object of concentration, thinking, My consciousness is infinite and perfecting and abiding in the base of infinite consciousness.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gcig yin no //ğŸ”½gzhan yang dper na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gcig yin no // gzhan yang dper na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: This is one type of inference.ğŸ”½Moreover, for example, they say that space is a thing because it is said,

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba dang / de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba dang / de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba dang /
translated: They completely transcend the base of infinite space in all aspects and thinking, My consciousness is infinite, they perfect and abide in the base of infinite consciousness and they completely transcend the base of infinite consciousness in all aspects and thinking, Nothing exists, they perfect and abide in the base of nothingness.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa
translated: They completely transcend the base of nothing at all and having completely transcended the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment they abide in the base of infinite space.

original: la sogs pa dag dngos po yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' yang de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs @76a * //
analyzed: la sogs pa dag dngos po yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' yang de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs @76a * //
translated: Just as consciousness and so on are things, so too space is also a thing since it is said:

original: kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs rnams yod la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis
analyzed: kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs rnams yod la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis
translated: They completely transcend discernment of form and the discernment of obstruction completely disappears and they abide having completed the base of infinite space since they think, Space is infinite since it does not create various forms.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' yang dngos po yin no zhes zer te de yang rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' yang dngos po yin no zhes zer te de yang rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gcig yin no //
translated: Space is a thing because it is the focal object of meditative attainment.ğŸ”½This is another inference.ğŸ”½Moreover, just as nirvana is a thing because it is unconditioned, so too space is a thing because it is unconditioned.

original: gzhan yang dper na mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dngos po yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' yang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dngos po yin no zhes zer te de yang rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dngos po yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' yang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dngos po yin no zhes zer te de yang rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gcig yin no //
translated: This is another inference.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: 'di la don dam par nam mkha' de dngos po nyid du 'dod na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'am mtshan nyid yin grang na /
analyzed: 'di la don dam par nam mkha' de dngos po nyid du 'dod na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'am mtshan nyid yin grang na /
translated: If space is asserted to be a thing ultimately, is it the basis of the characteristics or the characteristics?

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid de dag ci ltar mi srid pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin pas des na gang gi phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs las /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid de dag ci ltar mi srid pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin pas des na gang gi phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs las /
translated: Since it has already been explained how the basis of the characteristics and the characteristics are impossible, therefore,

original: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: And apart from the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves,

original: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
translated: there is no existent thing.

original: de'i phyir dpe ma bstan par bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe ma bstan par bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, you say that without positing an example, the probandum is not established.

original: bye brag tu smra ba chos mngon pa'i lo rgyus la mkhas su re ba khyed dang / lhan cig tu chos mngon pa'i lo rgyus dag je dpyad par byas nyon cig //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba chos mngon pa'i lo rgyus la mkhas su re ba khyed dang / lhan cig tu chos mngon pa'i lo rgyus dag je dpyad par byas nyon cig //
translated: You who are skilled in the history of Abhidharma, listen and reflect as we analyze the history of Abhidharma together.

original: khyod chos mngon pa pa dag don dam par nam mkha' dngos po nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs la chos can nam mkha' de don dam par dngos po nyid yin par bsgrub par bye grang na /
analyzed: khyod chos mngon pa pa dag don dam par nam mkha' dngos po nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs la chos can nam mkha' de don dam par dngos po nyid yin par bsgrub par bye grang na /
translated: You who are an Abhidharma master, if you prove that the subject, space, is ultimately a thing, in your position that space is ultimately a thing,

original: nam mkha' don dam par dngos po nyid du 'dod na de mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'am mtshan nyid cig yin grang na /
analyzed: nam mkha' don dam par dngos po nyid du 'dod na de mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'am mtshan nyid cig yin grang na /
translated: if you assert that space is ultimately a thing, is it the basis of those characteristics or is it the characteristics themselves?

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid de dag don dam par ci ltar mi srid pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin pas des na gang gi phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid de dag don dam par ci ltar mi srid pa de ltar ni sngar bstan zin pas des na gang gi phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang
translated: Since it has already been demonstrated how the basis of those characteristics and those characteristics are impossible in the ultimate, therefore, since in our system there is no entity that is not included within the basis of those characteristics and those characteristics,

original: yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir khyed kyi chos can nam mkha' dang bsgrub par bya ba chos dngos po nyid du 'dod pa ma grub pas khyed kyi phyogs nyams so //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir khyed kyi chos can nam mkha' dang bsgrub par bya ba chos dngos po nyid du 'dod pa ma grub pas khyed kyi phyogs nyams so //
translated: your subject, space, and the predicate of the probandum, entity, are not established. Therefore your position is undermined.

original: de ltar phyogs nyams pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dang dpe yang gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i @76b phyogs la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs nyams pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dang dpe yang gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i @76b phyogs la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Since your position is undermined, the reason and example are also not established, and thus they are not established for both parties.

original: 'on kyang yang bsnan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang yang bsnan par bya ste /
translated: However, we will add this.

original: khyed kyis brloms te smras pa'i dpe gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag med par khyed kyi bsgrub par bya ba nam mkha' dngos po yin te zhes bya ba de 'grub pa med do //
analyzed: khyed kyis brloms te smras pa'i dpe gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dag med par khyed kyi bsgrub par bya ba nam mkha' dngos po yin te zhes bya ba de 'grub pa med do //
translated: â€œLike the example you imagineâ€ and â€œlike consciousness and so onâ€ do not exist, and so your thesis â€œSpace is a thingâ€ is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par khyed kyi dpe gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag ma grub ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par khyed kyi dpe gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag ma grub ste /
translated: In our system, â€œlike the example you imagineâ€ and â€œlike consciousness and so onâ€ are not established ultimately.

original: gal te 'di la don dam par gzugs kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag dngos po nyid du yod na de dag kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'am mtshan nyid cig yin grang na /
analyzed: gal te 'di la don dam par gzugs kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag dngos po nyid du yod na de dag kyang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi 'am mtshan nyid cig yin grang na /
translated: If in this system form and so on were to exist ultimately as things, they would be either the basis of characteristics or characteristics.

original: de la yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid de dag ci ltar mi srid pa de ltar sngar bstan zin pas khyed kyi dpe de dag kyang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de la yang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid de dag ci ltar mi srid pa de ltar sngar bstan zin pas khyed kyi dpe de dag kyang ma grub ste /
translated: But since it has already been explained how the basis of characteristics and characteristics are impossible, your examples are not established.

original: de'i phyir dpe ma bstan par bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa med do zhes smras so /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe ma bstan par bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa med do zhes smras so /
translated: Therefore, you say, â€œWithout positing an example, the probandum is not established.â€

original: khyed kyis brloms te smras pa'i gtan tshigs yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de dag kyang nam mkha' dngos po yin pa'i gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: khyed kyis brloms te smras pa'i gtan tshigs yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de dag kyang nam mkha' dngos po yin pa'i gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /
translated: The reason you boastfully state, â€œBecause it is the object of the desire that is abandonedâ€ and â€œBecause it is the object of meditative attainmentâ€ are not suitable as reasons to prove that space is a thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: chos mngon pa nyid las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid ni chags pa dang zhen pa dang 'chums pa dang lhag par chags pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs dag yin par gsungs te /

translated: The Abhidharma itself states that the characteristics of desire realm attachment and existence attachment are synonyms such as attachment, clinging, craving, and excessive attachment.

analyzed: de la gang gi tshe rnal 'byor ba de gzugs kyi yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong zhing nam mkha'i yul de la snyoms par 'jug pa'i skabs su de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te / thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i tshe na rnal 'byor pa de rnam pa thams cad du kha dog gi bdag nyid kyi gzugs la dmigs par mi byed pas ni gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das so //
translated: When yogis abandon attachment to the object of form and enter meditative attainment on the object of space, they completely transcend perceptions of form.

original: dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs la dmigs par mi byed pas ni thogs pa'i 'du shes @77a * //ğŸ”½rnams nub par gyur to //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs la dmigs par mi byed pas ni thogs pa'i 'du shes @77a * //ğŸ”½rnams nub par gyur to //
translated: When it is said that they completely transcend perceptions of form, they do not focus on form that has the nature of color.ğŸ”½When it is said that perceptions of obstruction have disappeared, they do not focus on form that has the nature of shape.ğŸ”½When it is said that they do not mentally engage various perceptions, they do not focus on the various shapes of form.

original: sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs la dmigs par mi byed pas ni sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs la dmigs par mi byed pas ni sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pa yin te /
translated: Since they do not focus on the form of clouds, smoke, dust, mist, shadows, sunshine, light, darkness, color, shape, or the nature of both, they do not pay attention to the various kinds of perceptions.

analyzed: des nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa de'i tshe na rnal 'byor pa de nam mkha'i yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags yod kyang gzugs kyi yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags ldog par 'gyur pas
translated: When they think, â€œSpace is infinite,â€ and they complete and remain in the station of the sense field of infinite space, at that time the yogins and yoginÄ«s have a desire for the object of space, but they have turned away from the desire for the object of form.

original: 'dod chags dang gzugs de dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gzugs de dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, desire and form do not exist as real things.

translated: thinks, â€œConsciousness is infinite,â€ and he abides in the perfect accomplishment of the base of infinite consciousness.

translated: At that time the yogi thinks, â€œThe thing that I have imagined, namely, that space is infinite, does not exist.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig go snyam nas de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig go snyam nas de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas
translated: Thinking that this is just a conceptualization of consciousness, they completely transcend the base of infinite space and think, â€œConsciousness is infinite,â€ and they perfect the base of infinite consciousness.

translated: At that time, although the yogi has desire and attachment to the object of consciousness, the desire and attachment to the object of space is eliminated. Therefore neither desire nor space are real things.

translated: The thing that I have investigated, namely, â€˜Consciousness is infinite,â€™

translated: When it is said, â€œThe yogi has desire and attachment to the object of nothing at all, but he has overcome desire and attachment to the object of consciousness,â€ desire and consciousness do not exist.

translated: When this is stated, the yogi thinks, â€œThe discernment that thinks, â€˜Nothing exists at allâ€™ is not a real thing.ğŸ”½It is neither existent nor nonexistent.â€

translated: At that time, although the yogi has the desire of attachment to the object that is neither existent nor nonexistent, the desire of attachment to the object that is nothing at all is reversed. Therefore, desire and nothing at all are not existent things.

analyzed: de yan chad srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i lam de nyid kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam skyed par mi nus pas /

translated: At that time, the yogi sees that the desire of attachment, the discernment of form, space, consciousness, nothingness, and neither existence nor nonexistence are all devoid of essence. Therefore, he rests in equipoise on the vajra like concentration

analyzed: la dmigs pa med pa'i tshul gyis mnyam par gzhag ste /

translated: The full, manifest enlightenment of omniscience is the seeing of non-entityness.ğŸ”½

original: ba'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: ba'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The fruition of seeing things as having no real existence is the full realization of omniscience.

original: de ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du chos mngon pa nyid kyi lo rgyus las gsungs bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du chos mngon pa nyid kyi lo rgyus las gsungs bzhin du /
translated: Thus, in the Abhidharma, space and all other phenomena are said to be devoid of real existence.

original: khyed cag chos mngon pa'i lung la brten cing nam mkha' dngos po yod par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ston pa ni khyed rang gi tshig de nyid kyis khyed cag rang nyid chos mngon pa'i lo rgyus la shin du rmongs pa nyid du bstan pa yin no
analyzed: khyed cag chos mngon pa'i lung la brten cing nam mkha' dngos po yod par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ston pa ni khyed rang gi tshig de nyid kyis khyed cag rang nyid chos mngon pa'i lo rgyus la shin du rmongs pa nyid du bstan pa yin no
translated: You, on the other hand, who rely on the Abhidharma scriptures and who teach that space is a real entity, are proving by your own words that you are utterly ignorant of the Abhidharma.

analyzed: // 'dir chos mngon pa pa dag na re nged kyi nam mkha' dngos po yod par ma grub pas gzhi ma grub pa'i yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dper na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs dang dpe dag ma grub tu zin kyang kho bo cag gis yang na 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe de khyed la yang grub pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs dang dpe de grub pas nam mkha' dngos po yin par 'grub bo zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir
translated: Abhidharmikas say: Since our space is not established as an existent thing, the reason and example that we state, for example, like form, in order to abandon attachment to the object that is not established as a basis, and for example, like consciousness, in order to abandon attachment to the object that is not established as a meditative equipoise, are not established.ğŸ”½However, the reason and example that we state, for example, like nirvana, because it is unconditioned, are established for you. Therefore our reason and example are established and space is established as an existent thing.

original: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this former opponent, the author of the commentaryğŸ”½says:

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang gzhan gang yang rung ba dag kyang dngos po nyid du grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: Whatever is called â€œnirvanaâ€ or â€œunconditionedâ€ and so on is not established as a thing ultimately, and therefore your reason and example are not established.

original: 'dis ni sde pa gzhan dag gi sgrub pa /
analyzed: 'dis ni sde pa gzhan dag gi sgrub pa /
translated: This also replies to the faults in the proofs of other schools,

original: nam mkha' yod pa kho na yin te gzugs yongs su chad pa'i phyir dang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dag la yang skyon gyis lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' yod pa kho na yin te gzugs yongs su chad pa'i phyir dang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dag la yang skyon gyis lan btab pa yin te /
translated: such as â€œSpace certainly exists because it is the cessation of form and it is unconditioned.â€

analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be said that the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: Apart from the characterized and the characteristic,

analyzed: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
translated: A thing also does not exist.

translated: This reasoning as it has been explained refutes the proofs of other schools, which are similar to the one just mentioned, by showing that they have the faults of unestablished bases, reasons, and examples.

translated: The meaning of the statement â€œThe faults of unestablished objects of affirmation should be stated as appropriateâ€ is that the faults of unestablished objects of affirmation should be stated as appropriate to the following proofs of other schools: â€œSpace exists because form is limited and because it is unconditioned.â€

original: de dag gi sgrub pa de yang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /

analyzed: nam mkha' ni gzugs yongs su chad pa'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa kho na yin te /

translated: Because you have repeatedly stated that the aggregates, elements and bases do not exist through the aggregates and so on, therefore, since they exist in dependence, things definitely exist.

original: bya ba ni kho bo cag bye brag tu smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de dag gi don ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba ni kho bo cag bye brag tu smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de dag gi don ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: This is not the case. For us Vaibhasikas, the meaning of the reason is that it is in order to abandon attachment to objects that are objects of desire and it is in order to focus on meditative attainment and it is in order to focus on unconditioned states.

original: 'di ltar dbu ma pa khyod kyis lan cig ma yin par dang po rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nas brtsams te 'di'i bar du lan du mar phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag phung po skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid kyis med pa nyid du
analyzed: 'di ltar dbu ma pa khyod kyis lan cig ma yin par dang po rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nas brtsams te 'di'i bar du lan du mar phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag phung po skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid kyis med pa nyid du
translated: In this way, you Followers of the Middle Way have stated on numerous occasions, beginning in the chapter on conditions, that the aggregates, constituents, and sources do not exist by way of their own entities.

original: brjod pas phung po la sogs pa de dag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yod par bsgrubs pa de'i phyir phung po la sogs pa dngos po yod pa de dag la ltos pas de dag med pa yod pa'i phung po la sogs pa de dag
analyzed: brjod pas phung po la sogs pa de dag gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yod par bsgrubs pa de'i phyir phung po la sogs pa dngos po yod pa de dag la ltos pas de dag med pa yod pa'i phung po la sogs pa de dag
translated: You have established that the nonexistence of the entities of the aggregates and so on is existent. Therefore, since the aggregates and so on are dependent on existent things, their nonexistence is also dependent on existent things.

original: dngos po yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The aggregates and so on are existent things.

original: de dag dngos po yod pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: de dag dngos po yod pa kho na yin pas /
translated: Since the aggregates and so on are existent things,

original: yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de dag gi don ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba nam mkha' dngos po yin te zhes bya ba'i don de 'grub bo //
analyzed: yul de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de dag gi don ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba nam mkha' dngos po yin te zhes bya ba'i don de 'grub bo //
translated: Because it is the object of the desire that is abandoned, because it is the focal object of meditative attainment, and because it is unconditioned, these reasons are not unestablished.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: kho bos gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa nyid dgag pa byas par zad kyi de dag med par ma bstan pas de'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin na gang la ro nyid med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kho bos gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa nyid dgag pa byas par zad kyi de dag med par ma bstan pas de'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin na gang la ro nyid med par 'gyur te /
translated: We have merely refuted the existence of things such as form, but we have not taught that they are nonexistent. Therefore, if things called form do not exist, then what would be without taste?

original: de med pa'i phyir dpe ma grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dpe ma grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since that does not exist, the example is not established. Therefore, the intended meaning is not established.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag gi sgrub pa de la yang dpe mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag gi sgrub pa de la yang dpe mi 'grub bo //
translated: The VaibhÄá¹£ikaâ€™s proof is not established by an example.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /ğŸ”½kho bos med par dgag pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag gi dngos po yod pa nyid dgag pa byas par zad kyi ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul gyi gzugs la sogs pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched de
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / kho bos med par dgag pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag gi dngos po yod pa nyid dgag pa byas par zad kyi ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul gyi gzugs la sogs pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched de
translated: Why is that?ğŸ”½We have refuted the existence of the entities of form, etc., as aggregates, elements, and sense bases by way of a negation that is an exclusion.

original: dag med par ma bstan @81a * //
analyzed: dag med par ma bstan @81a * //
translated: We have not taught that form, etc., as aggregates, elements, and sense bases do not exist by way of a negation that is an implicative negation.

original: pas de'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin na gang la ltos pas de la ro nyid med pa yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pas de'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin na gang la ltos pas de la ro nyid med pa yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if the entity called â€œformâ€ does not exist, then what is it that lacks taste?

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin pas dngos po med pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin pas dngos po med pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the entity does not exist, the nonentity also does not exist.

original: dngos po yod pa la ltos pas dngos po med pa yod pa de med pa'i phyir khyod kyi dpe 'di na gang yod pa de la ni ltos pas dngos po med pa yod de dper na gzugs la ro nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la ltos pas dngos po med pa yod pa de med pa'i phyir khyod kyi dpe 'di na gang yod pa de la ni ltos pas dngos po med pa yod de dper na gzugs la ro nyid med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma
translated: Since nonthing exists in reliance on thing, your example is not established.

original: grub pas khyod kyi 'dod pa'i don nam mkha' dngos po yin te zhes bya ba de grub pa med do //
analyzed: grub pas khyod kyi 'dod pa'i don nam mkha' dngos po yin te zhes bya ba de grub pa med do //
translated: Since your example is not established, your intended meaning that space is a thing is not established.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /ğŸ”½dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Others say:

original: de dag shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Things and nonthings definitely exist because their cognition exists.ğŸ”½Here, whatever exists has a cognition, like the intrinsic reality of things.

original: 'di na gang la shes pa yod pa de ni yod de dper na chos nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa'i gang zag yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis dngos po
analyzed: 'di na gang la shes pa yod pa de ni yod de dper na chos nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa'i gang zag yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis dngos po
translated: Here, the SautrÄntikas and VaibhÄá¹£ikas prove that things and nonthings exist because the person who cognizes them exists.

original: dang dngos po med pa dag kyang yod par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: dang dngos po med pa dag kyang yod par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: They also prove that things and nonthings exist because their cognition exists.

original: de dag ni sgrub pa de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni sgrub pa de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the proofs, and the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example of similar class are to be applied in order.

original: dper na chos nyid la ni de mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yod pa'i phyir chos nyid kyang yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du dngos po de dang dngos po med pa dag la yang de dag shes pa'i rnal 'byor ba yod pa'i phyir dngosğŸ”½po dang dngos po med pa gang dag kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na chos nyid la ni de mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yod pa'i phyir chos nyid kyang yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du dngos po de dang dngos po med pa dag la yang de dag shes pa'i rnal 'byor ba yod pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa gang dag kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, just as the reality of the Buddha Bhagavan who knows that exists, so too, the yogi who knows those things and nonthings exists, and therefore those things and nonthings also exist.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here states:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: pha rol po'i yid la bsams pas brtags pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa de yang dngos po'am dngos po med pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: pha rol po'i yid la bsams pas brtags pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa de yang dngos po'am dngos po med pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: The cognition of things and nonthings imagined by the mind of the opponent is either a thing or a nonthing.

original: de gnyi ga dgag pa yang bstan zin pas de dag shes pa yod par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga dgag pa yang bstan zin pas de dag shes pa yod par mi 'grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the refutation of both of those has already been explained, it is said that the existence of consciousness is not established.

original: pha rol po mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis yid la bsams pas brtags pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa zhig yod par gyur na de yang dngos po'am dngos po med pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: pha rol po mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis yid la bsams pas brtags pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa zhig yod par gyur na de yang dngos po'am dngos po med pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: If the SÅ«tra Followers and the Particularists, the opponents, think that there is a consciousness that cognizes things and nonthings that are imputed by thought, then is that consciousness a thing or a nonthing?

original: de gnyi ga dgag pa yang bstan zin te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga dgag pa yang bstan zin te /
translated: The refutation of both of those has already been explained.

original: de la shes pa de dngos @81b po ni ma yin te nam mkha'i dngos po dgag pa ji skad bstan pa nyid kyis bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shes pa de dngos @81b po ni ma yin te nam mkha'i dngos po dgag pa ji skad bstan pa nyid kyis bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Regarding that, consciousness is not a thing because it has already been refuted by the refutation of space that was explained above.

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin te ma skyes pa'i phyir ma skyes pa la 'jig pa yang med pas dngos po med pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin te ma skyes pa'i phyir ma skyes pa la 'jig pa yang med pas dngos po med pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not a nonthing because it is not unarisen. Since there is no disintegration of what is unarisen, it is also not a nonthing.

original: de ltar shes pa de dngos po 'am dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid du ma grub pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa de dngos po 'am dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid du ma grub pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa med do //
translated: Since such consciousness is not established as having the nature of an entity or a nonentity, there is no consciousness of an entity or a nonentity.

original: de med pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag kyang yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //ğŸ”½dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa'i shes pa gzhan zhig yod par rtog na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa de dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin pa dngos po med
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag kyang yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o // dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa'i shes pa gzhan zhig yod par rtog na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa de dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin pa dngos po med
translated: Since that does not exist, entities and nonentities do not exist.ğŸ”½If you imagine that there is another consciousness that is not compatible with an entity or a nonentity,ğŸ”½if the opponent imagines that the consciousness of an entity or a nonentity is not the entity itself, nor is it the nature of a nonentity, and therefore it is not established as existent,

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin pas yod par ma grub pa dang / de dag 'dir 'di skad ces dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga dang mi mthun pa dngos po yang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin pa gzhan zhig yod par rtog cing de skad ces
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin pas yod par ma grub pa dang / de dag 'dir 'di skad ces dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga dang mi mthun pa dngos po yang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin pa gzhan zhig yod par rtog cing de skad ces
translated: and they say this: â€œThe consciousness of an entity or a nonentity is another consciousness that is not compatible with either an entity or a nonentity, and it is both an entity and a nonentity,â€

original: zer ba yin no //
analyzed: zer ba yin no //
translated: That is what is said.ğŸ”½If you think in that way, that also is not tenable.

original: de ltar rtog na de yang mi rung ste de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar rtog na de yang mi rung ste de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dngos dang dngos med mi mthun chos //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med mi mthun chos //
translated: Things and nonthings are incompatible phenomena.

original: gang gis dngos dang dngos med shes //
analyzed: gang gis dngos dang dngos med shes //
translated: By what means does one know things and nonthings?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the statement â€œThat does not existâ€ is this:

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni phan tshun mi mthun pa'i chos yin pas de gnyis gang zag gcig gi rgyud la yod par mi 'thad pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa'i gang zag dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni phan tshun mi mthun pa'i chos yin pas de gnyis gang zag gcig gi rgyud la yod par mi 'thad pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa shes pa'i gang zag dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa
translated: Since things and nonthings are mutually incompatible phenomena, it is untenable that both exist in the mindstream of a single person. Therefore, the person who knows things and nonthings is not compatible with things and nonthings.

original: dngos po yang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin pa de lta bu ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po yang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin pa de lta bu ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: That which is both a thing and a nonthing does not exist.

original: de med na gang gis dngos po med pa dag shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na gang gis dngos po med pa dag shes par 'gyur te /
translated: If that does not exist, by what means does one know nonthings?

original: gang gis kyang shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis kyang shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not know anything by means of that.

original: de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag shes pa'i gang zag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag kyang yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //ğŸ”½gal te rnam grangs kyi tshul smra ba dag gis brtags pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa de dag shes pa yod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dir 'ug pa pa rnam gnyis su smra ba
analyzed: de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag shes pa'i gang zag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag kyang yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gal te rnam grangs kyi tshul smra ba dag gis brtags pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mi mthun pa de dag shes pa yod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dir 'ug pa pa rnam gnyis su smra ba
translated: Thus, because the person who knows things and nonthings does not exist, things and nonthings also do not exist.ğŸ”½If you say that there is no error because the person who knows things and nonthings exists, since they are imagined by proponents of the system of enumeration,

original: dag na re kho bo cag ni rnam grangs kyi tshul gyis gnyi ga yin par smras te /ğŸ”½dper na pha'i rnam @82a * //
analyzed: dag na re kho bo cag ni rnam grangs kyi tshul gyis gnyi ga yin par smras te / dper na pha'i rnam @82a * //
translated: if here the owl-like proponents of the system of enumeration say, â€œWe say both are so by the system of enumeration.ğŸ”½For example, in dependence on the enumeration of father,

original: grangs la ltos nas ni bu yang yin la /
analyzed: grangs la ltos nas ni bu yang yin la /
translated: the son is also a father,ğŸ”½and in dependence on the enumeration of son,ğŸ”½the father is also a son.

original: bu'i rnam grangs la ltos nas ni pha yang yin pa de bzhin du lus kyi rnam grangs la ltos nas ni dngos po yang yin la srog gi rnam grangs la ltos nas ni dngos po med pa yang yin pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la dngosğŸ”½po dang dngos po med par shes pa'i gang zag de ni dngos po yang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin par 'grub pas khyed kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa mi mthun pa'i chos gnyis gang zag gcig gi rgyud la yod pa ma yin no
analyzed: bu'i rnam grangs la ltos nas ni pha yang yin pa de bzhin du lus kyi rnam grangs la ltos nas ni dngos po yang yin la srog gi rnam grangs la ltos nas ni dngos po med pa yang yin pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la dngos po dang dngos po med par shes pa'i gang zag de ni dngos po yang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin par 'grub pas khyed kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa mi mthun pa'i chos gnyis gang zag gcig gi rgyud la yod pa ma yin no
translated: Just as a father is a son in terms of being a sonâ€™s class, in the same way, in terms of being the class of body, it is a thing, and in terms of being the class of life, it is a nonthing.ğŸ”½Therefore, in our system, the person who understands things and nonthings is established as both a thing and a nonthing.

original: zhes bshad pa'i nyes pa de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i nyes pa de kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the fault that you stated, â€œTwo incompatible phenomena, a thing and a nonthing, do not exist in the mindstream of a single person,â€ does not apply to our system.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te gcig la bdag nyid mi mthun pa gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te gcig la bdag nyid mi mthun pa gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that statement, this commentary explains that the assertion is illogical because it is impossible for a single thing to have two incompatible natures, because it is untenable to rely on it, and because there is no inference that reveals it.

original: 'ug pa pa dag gi tshul de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ug pa pa dag gi tshul de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The system of the owl is also illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /ğŸ”½dngos po gcig la yod pa yang yin med pa yang yin zhes bya ba bdag nyid mi mthun pa gnyis mi srid de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / dngos po gcig la yod pa yang yin med pa yang yin zhes bya ba bdag nyid mi mthun pa gnyis mi srid de /
translated: Why?ğŸ”½It is impossible for a single thing to be both existent and nonexistent, because it is impossible to say that it is both light and dark.

original: dper na de nyid snang ba yin la mun pa yang yin no zhes bya ba lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir dang ltos pa yang mi 'thad de shi ba la ltos nas gson po yin la gson pa la ltos nas shi ba yin no zhes bya ba dper
analyzed: dper na de nyid snang ba yin la mun pa yang yin no zhes bya ba lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir dang ltos pa yang mi 'thad de shi ba la ltos nas gson po yin la gson pa la ltos nas shi ba yin no zhes bya ba dper
translated: It is also untenable to rely on it, because it is like saying that a living being is alive in reliance on death and that a living being is dead in reliance on life.

original: na bya gag phyed shi phyed sos pa lta bu mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa gnyis yin pa de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa khyed la med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: na bya gag phyed shi phyed sos pa lta bu mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa gnyis yin pa de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa khyed la med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: because it is untenable that the sky is half-dead and half-alive, like a chicken, and because you do not have an inference that demonstrates that it has two aspects.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dpyad na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dpyad na /
translated: Since this is analyzed in that way,

original: nam mkha' 'thad pa mi bzod pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'thad pa mi bzod pa //
translated: the sky is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' dngos po min //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' dngos po min //
translated: Therefore the sky is not a thing.
