original: chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dag gi mtshan nyid sra ba dang / g-yo ba dang / skabs 'byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa dag yod par bstan zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab la khams de dag de ltar yod par bstan pa ni de ltar bstan pas
analyzed: chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba dag gi mtshan nyid sra ba dang / g-yo ba dang / skabs 'byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa dag yod par bstan zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab la khams de dag de ltar yod par bstan pa ni de ltar bstan pas
translated: The prior position is drawn out from within:ğŸ”½The author of the commentary replies to this:ğŸ”½The teaching that those elements exist in that way in the scriptures of the Bhagavat is a teaching thatğŸ”½the Bhagavat, out of compassion for the many beings to be tamed, spoke in terms of conventional truth, which is renowned in the world.ğŸ”½In the ultimate, the elements do not exist.

original: gdul ba'i skye bo mang po la rjes su thugs brtse bas tha snyad du grags pa tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi don dam par ni khams rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te khams de dag bstan pas 'dul ba'i skye bo
analyzed: gdul ba'i skye bo mang po la rjes su thugs brtse bas tha snyad du grags pa tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi don dam par ni khams rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te khams de dag bstan pas 'dul ba'i skye bo
translated: The teaching of those elements is for the sake of taming those to be tamed.

original: rgyal po chen po zas gtsang la sogs pa las dang po pa rnams la rjes su thugs brtse bas de dag gdul zhing gzung pa dang rab tu 'god pa'i phyir tha snyad du grags pa'i dbang du mdzad nas rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni
analyzed: rgyal po chen po zas gtsang la sogs pa las dang po pa rnams la rjes su thugs brtse bas de dag gdul zhing gzung pa dang rab tu 'god pa'i phyir tha snyad du grags pa'i dbang du mdzad nas rgyal po chen po khams drug po 'di dag ni
translated: He said, â€œGreat king, these six elementsğŸ”½are the person.â€

original: skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pas khams drug po sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes zhes bya ba dag gi mtshan nyid sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang g-yo ba dang skabs 'byed pa dang rnam par shes par byed pa dag yod par bstan te de dag ni tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi don dam
analyzed: skyes bu'o zhes gsungs pas khams drug po sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes zhes bya ba dag gi mtshan nyid sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang g-yo ba dang skabs 'byed pa dang rnam par shes par byed pa dag yod par bstan te de dag ni tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yin gyi don dam
translated: Thus he taught that the six elementsâ€”earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousnessâ€”exist, and their characteristics are solidity, liquidity, heat, motility, providing an open space, and consciousness.

original: par ni khams rnams yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: par ni khams rnams yod pa ma yin no //
translated: These are included in conventional truth, but ultimately the elements do not exist.ğŸ”½The Buddhaâ€™s scriptures

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi @84b gsung rab la zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir gsung rab ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi @84b gsung rab la zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir gsung rab ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called scriptures?

original: yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba dang mngon sum du bya ba dang bsgom par bya ba'i bden pa bzhi po dag la gdams ngag dang rjes su ston pa'i gsung gang yin pa de ni gsung rab po //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba dang mngon sum du bya ba dang bsgom par bya ba'i bden pa bzhi po dag la gdams ngag dang rjes su ston pa'i gsung gang yin pa de ni gsung rab po //
translated: The speech that is advice and instruction concerning the four noble truths that are to be thoroughly known, abandoned, realized, and cultivated is the Excellent Speech.

original: yang na las dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa brnyes pa'i gsung gang yin pa de ni gsung rab po //
analyzed: yang na las dang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa brnyes pa'i gsung gang yin pa de ni gsung rab po //
translated: Or, the speech that has attained the ultimate perfection of the abandonment of the obscurations of karma, affliction, and the knowable is the Excellent Speech.

original: yang na skye bo skal ba dang ldan pa 'khor ba'i btson rar chud pa tshe rabs brgyud pas bsgribs pa dag rab tu thar bar mdzad pa'i gsung gang yin pa de ni gsung rab po //
analyzed: yang na skye bo skal ba dang ldan pa 'khor ba'i btson rar chud pa tshe rabs brgyud pas bsgribs pa dag rab tu thar bar mdzad pa'i gsung gang yin pa de ni gsung rab po //
translated: Or, the speech that liberates the fortunate who are imprisoned in the prison of cyclic existence, obscured by the continuity of lives, is the Excellent Speech.

original: yang na don dam par skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa la sogs pa rtogs pa nyid kyis rtogs par mdzad pa'i gsung gang yin pa de ni gsung rab po //
analyzed: yang na don dam par skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa la sogs pa rtogs pa nyid kyis rtogs par mdzad pa'i gsung gang yin pa de ni gsung rab po //
translated: Or, the speech that causes the realization of the ultimate, such as non-arising, non-cessation, non-annihilation, non-permanence, and so on, is the Excellent Speech.

original: yang na ser skya dang / gzegs zan dang / rkang mig dang / 'phel ba dang / khyab 'jug dang / lha chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa dag gis mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi 'byor ba chen po lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang 'gro ba rnams las brnyes pa'i gsung gang yin pa de ni gsung rab po //
analyzed: yang na ser skya dang / gzegs zan dang / rkang mig dang / 'phel ba dang / khyab 'jug dang / lha chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa dag gis mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi 'byor ba chen po lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang 'gro ba rnams las brnyes pa'i gsung gang yin pa de ni gsung rab po //
translated: Or else, it is the speech of the one who has attained great wealth, which cannot be taken away by anyone, such as Kapila, Kaá¹‡Äda, Aká¹£apÄda, Vá¹›ddha, Viá¹£á¹‡u, MaheÅ›vara, Indra, BrahmÄ, and so on, from among the gods, humans, asuras, and beings.

original: ji ltar des 'byor ba chen po de lta bu brnyes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar des 'byor ba chen po de lta bu brnyes she na /
translated: How did he attain such great wealth?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thun mong ma yin pa ston par mdzad dpa'i phyir dang / thugs rje chen po'i mthus phas kyi rgol ba nges par tshar gcod pa la sogs pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thun mong ma yin pa ston par mdzad dpa'i phyir dang / thugs rje chen po'i mthus phas kyi rgol ba nges par tshar gcod pa la sogs pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he teaches the unshared dependent origination, and because he has accumulated the qualities of definitely defeating opponents through the power of great compassion.

original: khams rnams yod pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med la /
analyzed: khams rnams yod pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med la /
translated: Since the elements exist, there is no contradiction with what is accepted.

original: skye mched rnams 'grub par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: skye mched rnams 'grub par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The statement â€œthe sense bases would not be establishedâ€ is the conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.

original: kun rdzob tu khams rnams yod pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu khams rnams yod pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med la /
translated: Since the elements exist conventionally, there is no fault in our assertion.

original: don dam par khams ngo bo nyid med par bstan pas skye mche rnams 'grub par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par khams ngo bo nyid med par bstan pas skye mche rnams 'grub par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the elements are shown to be ultimately essenceless, the sense bases would not be established.

original: yang kha cig na re khyod kyis don dam par dngos po thams cad la skur pa btab pa'i phyir log pa'i dngos po thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i tshul can rjes su brjod pas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab ltar bcos pas 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i
analyzed: yang kha cig na re khyod kyis don dam par dngos po thams cad la skur pa btab pa'i phyir log pa'i dngos po thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i tshul can rjes su brjod pas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab ltar bcos pas 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i
translated: Some say that you are a nihilist because you deprecate all things ultimately, and that you are a follower of the Lokayata because you advocate the Lokayata view that all things are not real.

original: 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' ma @85a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' ma @85a * //
translated: This is not the word of the Buddha, but rather a treatise composed by you to establish the tenets of the Lokayata.

original: yin bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis rjes su dpag pa dang sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang de kho na dag bstan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba zhi bar byed pa dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul bka' stsal pa 'di la rang gi sde pa dag las /
analyzed: yin bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis rjes su dpag pa dang sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang de kho na dag bstan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba zhi bar byed pa dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul bka' stsal pa 'di la rang gi sde pa dag las /
translated: The master's own words are: I have composed this treatise on the perfection of wisdom, which is endowed with the teaching of inference and refutation, the elucidation of reality, and the pacification of the net of bad views, in order to refute the bad views of those who are attached to the extremes of existence and non-existence, and in order to teach the correct path of the middle way to those who wish to attain nirvana.

original: 'dus bzang la sogs pa kha cig dbu ma'i bstan bcos brtsams pa dgag par 'dod pa dag dper na rab rib can 'ga' zhig gis skra shad dang / sbrang bu dang / sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa'i don yod pa ma yin pa rang gi mig gi skyon gyis sgro btags nas sel bar byed pa bzhin du dbu ma'i bstan bcos la chad par lta ba yod pa ma yin bzhin du de dag rang gi blo gros ngan pa'i
analyzed: 'dus bzang la sogs pa kha cig dbu ma'i bstan bcos brtsams pa dgag par 'dod pa dag dper na rab rib can 'ga' zhig gis skra shad dang / sbrang bu dang / sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa'i don yod pa ma yin pa rang gi mig gi skyon gyis sgro btags nas sel bar byed pa bzhin du dbu ma'i bstan bcos la chad par lta ba yod pa ma yin bzhin du de dag rang gi blo gros ngan pa'i
translated: Some of our own schools, such as Sanghabhadra, who wish to refute the composition of the Madhyamaka treatises, are like some people with eye disease who, due to the fault of their own eyes, superimpose the existence of unreal objects such as hairs, flies, and double moons, and then refute them.

original: skyon gyis sgro btags nas de nyan pa la mngon par tshogs pa dag phyir zlog par byed ces zer ba yin no //
analyzed: skyon gyis sgro btags nas de nyan pa la mngon par tshogs pa dag phyir zlog par byed ces zer ba yin no //
translated: Having imputed faults, they turn away those who are inclined to listen to it.ğŸ”½In response to that, here the author of the commentary himself says,

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de la 'dir pha rol po dag ni skyon cha ma mnyam pas rab rib skyes pa dag skra shad dang sbrang bu dang / sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa don yang dag pa ma yin pa dag sel bar byed pa dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de la 'dir pha rol po dag ni skyon cha ma mnyam pas rab rib skyes pa dag skra shad dang sbrang bu dang / sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa don yang dag pa ma yin pa dag sel bar byed pa dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Here, the opponents are like those born with cataracts who eliminate false objects such as floating hairs, flies, and swarms of bees.

original: pha rol po 'dus bzad la sogs pa glo gros chung du dbu ma'i bstan bcos brtsams pa dgag par 'dod pa dag ni dper na rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan kyi  skyon cha ma mnyam pas mig la rab rib skyes pa dag skra shad dang sbrang bu dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa'i don yang dag pa ma yin pa dag rang gi mig gi skyon gyis sgro btags nas sel bar byed pa dang
analyzed: pha rol po 'dus bzad la sogs pa glo gros chung du dbu ma'i bstan bcos brtsams pa dgag par 'dod pa dag ni dper na rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan kyi  skyon cha ma mnyam pas mig la rab rib skyes pa dag skra shad dang sbrang bu dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa'i don yang dag pa ma yin pa dag rang gi mig gi skyon gyis sgro btags nas sel bar byed pa dang
translated: Those with little intelligence, such as the tÄ«rthikas, who wish to refute the treatises of the Middle Way, are like those whose eyes are afflicted with myodesopsia, who, due to the imbalance of the elements of wind, bile, and phlegm, superimpose the existence of nonexistent things such as floaters, flies, and the like, due to the fault of their own eyes.

original: 'dra ste / ci lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'dra ste / ci lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis rjes su dpag pa dang sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang de kho na dag bstan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba zhi bar byed pa dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul bka' stsal pa 'di la rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i mtha' yod pa ma yin bzhin du 'dus bzang la sogs pa de dag rang gi blo
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis rjes su dpag pa dang sun dbyung ba'i gsal ba dang de kho na dag bstan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba zhi bar byed pa dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul bka' stsal pa 'di la rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i mtha' yod pa ma yin bzhin du 'dus bzang la sogs pa de dag rang gi blo
translated: However, those who are inclined to listen to that teaching, such as Saá¹…ghabhadra, superimpose the extremes of eternalism and nihilism due to the fault of their own bad intellect.

original: gros ngan pa'i skyon gyis sgro btags nas de nyan pa la mngon par phyogs pa dag phyir bzlog pa'i phyir dbu ma'i bstan bcos la yang dag pa ma yin pas sgro 'dogs par @85b byed pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: gros ngan pa'i skyon gyis sgro btags nas de nyan pa la mngon par phyogs pa dag phyir bzlog pa'i phyir dbu ma'i bstan bcos la yang dag pa ma yin pas sgro 'dogs par @85b byed pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: They do so in order to turn others away from listening to that teaching, but they are merely making false superimpositions on the treatise of the middle way.

original: dbu ma'i bstan bcos la rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbu ma'i bstan bcos la rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the treatise of the middle way does not have the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: ci ltar rtag pa dang chad par lta ba med ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar rtag pa dang chad par lta ba med ce na /
translated: How is it that it does not have the two views of eternalism and nihilism?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar kho bos ni skye mched rnams kyi yod pa nyid dgag pa smras pa na ngo bo nyid yod pa dgag pa byas par zad kyi dngos po med pa nyid du ni ma smras te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar kho bos ni skye mched rnams kyi yod pa nyid dgag pa smras pa na ngo bo nyid yod pa dgag pa byas par zad kyi dngos po med pa nyid du ni ma smras te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, when we say that the existence of the sensory bases is refuted, we are only refuting inherent existence, we are not saying that things are nonexistent.

original: kho bos med par dgag pa'i tshul gyis don dam par skye mched rnams kyi yod pa nyid dgag par zad kyi /
analyzed: kho bos med par dgag pa'i tshul gyis don dam par skye mched rnams kyi yod pa nyid dgag par zad kyi /
translated: We are only refuting the ultimate existence of the sensory bases by the method of nonaffirming negation.

original: ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa nyid du ni ma smras pas dbu ma'i bstan bcos la rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis med pa'i phyir chad par lta ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa nyid du ni ma smras pas dbu ma'i bstan bcos la rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis med pa'i phyir chad par lta ba ma yin te /
translated: We are not saying that they are nonexistent by the method of affirming negation. Therefore, because the treatise of the middle way is free of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism, it is not nihilism.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' yang dag pa yin pas dad pa mchog bskyed de bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' yang dag pa yin pas dad pa mchog bskyed de bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since this is the true word of the Bhagavan, one should generate supreme faith and practice it.

original: de ltar mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul bstan pa de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir mdo sde las ;
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul bstan pa de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir mdo sde las ;
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of the teaching of the method of avoiding the two extremes, the sutra says:

original: ji srid sems kyi spyod yul ba //
analyzed: ji srid sems kyi spyod yul ba //
translated: As long as the domain of mind exists,

original: yod med gnyis kyi mthar yang 'gyur //
analyzed: yod med gnyis kyi mthar yang 'gyur //
translated: it is at the extreme of existence and nonexistence.

original: spyod yul 'gag par gyur na ni //
analyzed: spyod yul 'gag par gyur na ni //
translated: When the domain ceases,

original: sems kyang yang dag 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems kyang yang dag 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: the mind also ceases.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dngos por ma lhung ba ni dngos po med pas chos 'ga' yang dngos po med par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dngos por ma lhung ba ni dngos po med pas chos 'ga' yang dngos po med par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ci skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: And similarly, â€œOne who does not fall into the existence of things does not make any non-existent thing into an existent thing.â€ğŸ”½In order to demonstrate the scriptural sources for this, which were stated by the Master himself in other treatises, he says, â€œSimilarly, the Master himself has said in other treatises,â€

original: 'dir slob dpon nyid kyis bstan bcos gzhan dag gi skabs su bka' stsal pa'i khungs kyang bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du slob dpon nyid kyis kyang gzhan dag tu /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon nyid kyis bstan bcos gzhan dag gi skabs su bka' stsal pa'i khungs kyang bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin du slob dpon nyid kyis kyang gzhan dag tu /
translated: and so on.

original: 'di ni yod nyid 'gog pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni yod nyid 'gog pa ste //
translated: This is the refutation of existence;

original: med nyid yongs su 'dzin pa min //ğŸ”½nag po min zhes smras pa na //
analyzed: med nyid yongs su 'dzin pa min // nag po min zhes smras pa na //
translated: it is not the affirmation of nonexistence.ğŸ”½When one says â€œIt is not black,â€

original: dkar po yin zhes ma brjod bzhin //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dkar po yin zhes ma brjod bzhin //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: one does not say â€œIt is white.â€

original: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis nyid kyis 'jig rten brtag pa zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos mdzad pa las de skad bka' stsal te /
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis nyid kyis 'jig rten brtag pa zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos mdzad pa las de skad bka' stsal te /
translated: Master Nagarjuna himself said this in his treatise called Examination of the World,

original: dper na 'ga' zhig gis nag po ma yin no zhes smras pas des nag po dgag pa tsam nyid byas par zad kyi /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig gis nag po ma yin no zhes smras pas des nag po dgag pa tsam nyid byas par zad kyi /
translated: For example, when someone says, â€œIt is not black,â€ he merely negates its blackness.ğŸ”½He does not indicate that it is white.

original: dkar po nyid du ma bstan pa de de bzhin du 'dir yang med par dgag pa'i tshul gyis yod pa nyid dgag pa tsam bstan pas /ğŸ”½ma yin @86a * //
analyzed: dkar po nyid du ma bstan pa de de bzhin du 'dir yang med par dgag pa'i tshul gyis yod pa nyid dgag pa tsam bstan pas / ma yin @86a * //
translated: Similarly, here, by the method of negation, he merely negates existence.

original: par dgag pa'i tshul gyis med pa nyid du ma bstan pas chad par lta ba ma yin no //ğŸ”½de'i phyir rnam pa de gnyi ga yang lta ba ngan pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yod pa dang med par lta ba rnam pa de gnyis ni rtag pa dang chad par lta ba yin pas gnyi ga yang lta ba ngan pa
analyzed: par dgag pa'i tshul gyis med pa nyid du ma bstan pas chad par lta ba ma yin no // de'i phyir rnam pa de gnyi ga yang lta ba ngan pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yod pa dang med par lta ba rnam pa de gnyis ni rtag pa dang chad par lta ba yin pas gnyi ga yang lta ba ngan pa
translated: He does not indicate nonexistence by the method of affirmation.ğŸ”½Therefore, both of these views are only bad views.

original: kho na yin te /
analyzed: kho na yin te /
translated: This passage shows that both of these views of existence and nonexistence are views of eternalism and nihilism, and that both are bad views.

original: de ltar lta ba des ni don dam pa mi mthong zhes tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma'i mgo 'dren pa ston to //

translated: Beings would be like pictures on a wall, with no change in their age, lifespan, or behavior.ğŸ”½This is the conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.

analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu de dag ni tha snyad par yod pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / de dag gi nyes dmigs kyi skyon bstan pa sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu de dag ni tha snyad par yod pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir phyogs snga ma smra ba dag gi phung po la sogs pa don dam par
translated: Those things that are like illusions, mirages, dreams, and cities of gandharvas exist conventionally, but not ultimately.

original: yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mi 'grub pas phung po la sogs pa don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //

translated: The afflictions such as attachment, aversion, and ignorance, and the faults that are their negative consequences, which are taught to be like illusions and so on, exist conventionally, but not ultimately. Therefore, the argument that the counterparts advance to prove that the aggregates and so on exist ultimately, namely, â€œbecause the afflictions and their negative consequences are taught,â€ is not established. Therefore, the aggregates and so on do not exist ultimately.

analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer lta bu zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: phyis sam / 'dod chags dang / chags pa dag lhan cig na yod pa'am 'dod chags chags pa'i snga rol na'am /

analyzed: de la yang mu dang po gsum ni 'dod chags brtag pa yin la /

original: mu tha ma gsum ni chags pa brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: mu tha ma gsum ni chags pa brtag pa yin no //
translated: The first three alternatives are the analysis of attachment.ğŸ”½The last three alternatives are the analysis of one who is attached.ğŸ”½The three alternatives of the analysis of attachment are:ğŸ”½1. Attachment is asserted to exist in dependence on one who is attached existing prior to attachment.

original: de la 'dod chags brtag pa'i mu gsum ni chags pa 'dod chags kyi snga rol na yod pa la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'dod pa dang / chags pa 'dod chags pas phyis yod pa la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags brtag pa'i mu gsum ni chags pa 'dod chags kyi snga rol na yod pa la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'dod pa dang / chags pa 'dod chags pas phyis yod pa la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'dod pa dang /
translated: 2. Attachment is asserted to exist in dependence on one who is attached existing later than attachment.

analyzed: chags pa dang 'dod chags lhan cig pa la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: 3. Attachment is asserted to exist in dependence on one who is attached and attachment existing simultaneously.ğŸ”½The three alternatives of the analysis of one who is attached are:ğŸ”½1. One who is attached is asserted to exist in dependence on attachment existing prior to one who is attached.ğŸ”½2. One who is attached is asserted to exist in dependence on attachment existing later than one who is attached.

original: chags pa brtag pa'i mu gsum ni 'dod chags chags pa'i snga rol na yod pa la brten nas chags pa yod par 'dod pa dang / 'dod chags chags pas phyis yod pa la brten nas chags pa yod par 'dod pa dang / 'dod chags dang chags pa lhan cig pa la brten nas chags pa yod par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa brtag pa'i mu gsum ni 'dod chags chags pa'i snga rol na yod pa la brten nas chags pa yod par 'dod pa dang / 'dod chags chags pas phyis yod pa la brten nas chags pa yod par 'dod pa dang / 'dod chags dang chags pa lhan cig pa la brten nas chags pa yod par 'dod pa ste /
translated: 3. One who is attached is asserted to exist in dependence on attachment and one who is attached existing simultaneously.

original: de dag thams cad mi 'thad par rim pa bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad mi 'thad par rim pa bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: All of these are untenable, and they will be proven to be so in order.

original: de la mu dang por bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mu dang por bsgrubs pa'i phyir /
translated: To prove the first possibility,

original: de la re zhig / gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
analyzed: de la re zhig / gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
translated: First, if prior to attachment

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
translated: Attachment exists without attachment,

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa 'dod chags med pa zhig yod par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /ğŸ”½'di la gal te khyed chags pa 'dod chags @93a * //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa 'dod chags med pa zhig yod par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te / 'di la gal te khyed chags pa 'dod chags @93a * //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is stated: â€œIf prior to attachment, attachment exists without attachment.â€ğŸ”½In this regard, if you assert that attachment exists prior to attachment,

analyzed: kyi snga rol na yod par 'dod na de ltar na khyed 'dod chags med pa'i snga rol na chags pa 'dod chags med pa zhig yod par bsgrub cing /
translated: in that case you would be proving that prior to attachment, attachment exists without attachment.

original: chags pa 'dod chags med pa de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: chags pa 'dod chags med pa de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur bas /
translated: And later, attachment would arise in dependence on that attachment that exists without attachment.

original: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa yang yod la de'i nyes dmigs kyang yod pas khyed phung po la sogs pa dag don dam par yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa yang yod la de'i nyes dmigs kyang yod pas khyed phung po la sogs pa dag don dam par yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, since there is also the thoroughly afflicted and its faults, the meaning of your reason proving that the aggregates and so on exist ultimately is established.

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa yod par gyur na chags pa de 'dod chags med par mi rung ste 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i chags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa yod par gyur na chags pa de 'dod chags med par mi rung ste 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i chags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If attachment existed prior to desire, then it would be impossible for attachment to exist without desire, because it would be attachment that possesses desire.

original: de'i tshe na de chags pa nyid yin par gyur na de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur ba don med pas chags pa la brten nas 'dod chags skye bar mi 'gyur bas 'dod chags mi skye'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na de chags pa nyid yin par gyur na de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur ba don med pas chags pa la brten nas 'dod chags skye bar mi 'gyur bas 'dod chags mi skye'o //
translated: If at that time it were attachment, then it would be pointless for desire to arise later in dependence on it. Therefore, since desire would not arise in dependence on attachment, desire would not arise.

original: des na 'dod chags med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med la /
analyzed: des na 'dod chags med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med la /
translated: Since desire does not exist, the thoroughly afflicted also does not exist.

original: de'i nyes dmigs kyang med pas khyod phung po la sogs pa dag don dam par yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs kyang med pas khyod phung po la sogs pa dag don dam par yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes ston to //
translated: Since there is no fault in that, you have not established the meaning of the reason that proves the aggregates and so on exist ultimately.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs te /
translated: â€œAttachment, one who is attached, and excessive attachmentâ€ are synonyms.

original: de med cing ma gtogs pa 'dod chags la mi ltos pa zhig yod par gyur na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de med cing ma gtogs pa 'dod chags la mi ltos pa zhig yod par gyur na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œIf it existed without it, without depending on attachmentâ€ explains the meaning of the words:

original: gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
translated: If prior to attachment

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na // zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bshad pa yin te /
translated: One who is attached existed without attachment.

original: 'dod chags zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dang lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dang lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
translated: â€œAttachment, one who is attached, and excessive attachmentâ€ are synonyms.

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
translated: If one who is attached existed without attachment,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni 'dod chags de med cing de ma gtogs pa 'dod chags la mi ltos pa'i chags pa 'dod chags med pa zhig yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni 'dod chags de med cing de ma gtogs pa 'dod chags la mi ltos pa'i chags pa 'dod chags med pa zhig yod par gyur na'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is this: If there were attachment that did not depend on attachment, that is, if there were attachment that did not exist due to the existence of attachment,

original: 'dir pha rol po'i bsam pa ni 'dod chags med pa'i snga rol na chags pa nyid mi 'thad pas phyis chags par 'gyur ba'i gang zag ma chags pa zhig yod pas de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags yod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa yin pas @93b
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po'i bsam pa ni 'dod chags med pa'i snga rol na chags pa nyid mi 'thad pas phyis chags par 'gyur ba'i gang zag ma chags pa zhig yod pas de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags yod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa yin pas @93b
translated: Here, the opponent thinks that since it is untenable that one is attached prior to the existence of attachment, there is a person who is not attached but who later becomes attached, and that later attachment exists in dependence on that person.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pas smin pa med par 'bras bu smin pa nyid mi 'thad pa ltar chags pa nyid mi 'thad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pas smin pa med par 'bras bu smin pa nyid mi 'thad pa ltar chags pa nyid mi 'thad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to dispel that, the author of the commentary says, â€œIt is not untenable that one is attached prior to attachment, just as it is not untenable that a fruit ripens prior to its ripening.â€

original: smin pa med par 'bras bu smin pa nyid mi 'thad pa ltar zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: smin pa med par 'bras bu smin pa nyid mi 'thad pa ltar zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te /
translated: â€œJust as it is not untenable that a fruit ripens prior to its ripeningâ€ is an example that is contrary to the example of the opponent.

original: ji ltar smin pa med par 'bras bu smin pa nyid mi 'thad pa ltar 'dod chags med par chags pa nyid mi 'thad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar smin pa med par 'bras bu smin pa nyid mi 'thad pa ltar 'dod chags med par chags pa nyid mi 'thad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as it is untenable that a ripened result is ripened without ripening, it is not untenable that attachment exists without attachment.

original: smin pa med par 'bras bu smin pa nyid mi 'thad kyang 'bras bu ma smin pa nyid yod pa ltar 'dod chags med par chags pa nyid mi 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smin pa med par 'bras bu smin pa nyid mi 'thad kyang 'bras bu ma smin pa nyid yod pa ltar 'dod chags med par chags pa nyid mi 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as it is untenable that a ripened result is ripened without ripening, but unripened results do exist, it is not untenable that attachment exists without attachment.

original: ma chags pa nyid med do //
analyzed: ma chags pa nyid med do //
translated: Nonattachment does not exist.

original: 'di skad bstan te pha rol po'i bsam pa ltar gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa yod par gyur na de 'dod chags med pa'i ma chags pa nyid ma yin gyi chags pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te pha rol po'i bsam pa ltar gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa yod par gyur na de 'dod chags med pa'i ma chags pa nyid ma yin gyi chags pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows: If attachment existed prior to attachment, then it would not be nonattachment that is without attachment, but attachment.

original: ji ltar smin pa med par 'bras bu ma smin pa nyid med kyang 'bras bu ma smin pa nyid yod pa ltar 'dir ni de lta ma yin te chags pa snga na yod pa de la 'dod chags med par chags pa nyid med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar smin pa med par 'bras bu ma smin pa nyid med kyang 'bras bu ma smin pa nyid yod pa ltar 'dir ni de lta ma yin te chags pa snga na yod pa de la 'dod chags med par chags pa nyid med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Just as it is untenable that an unripened result is unripened without ripening, but unripened results do exist, it is not the case that attachment exists without attachment.

original: de 'dod chags med kyang chags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½de'i tshe na de chags pa nyid yin par gyur na de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur ba don med pas chags pa la brten nas 'dod chags skye bar mi 'gyur bas 'dod chags mi skye'o //
analyzed: de 'dod chags med kyang chags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro // de'i tshe na de chags pa nyid yin par gyur na de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur ba don med pas chags pa la brten nas 'dod chags skye bar mi 'gyur bas 'dod chags mi skye'o //
translated: But if it exists prior to attachment, then it would be attachment even though there is no attachment.

original: des na 'dod chags med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med la de'i nyes dmigs kyang med pas khyed phung po la sogs pa dag don dam par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med la de'i nyes dmigs kyang med pas khyed phung po la sogs pa dag don dam par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: If it were attachment at that time, then it would be pointless for attachment to arise later in dependence on it. Therefore, attachment would not arise in dependence on attachment. Thus, since there would be no attachment, there would be no affliction, and since there would be no affliction, there would be no problem. Therefore, your reason proving the aggregates and so on to be ultimately existent is not established.ğŸ”½What is the point of this analysis?

original: brtag pa 'di las cir 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bsam pa ltar brtag pa /ğŸ”½gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
analyzed: brtag pa 'di las cir 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bsam pa ltar brtag pa / gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
translated: This is an analysis of the opponentâ€™s intended meaning.ğŸ”½If prior to attachment

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba 'di la don cir 'gyur zhe na zhes brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na // zhes bya ba 'di la don cir 'gyur zhe na zhes brtag pa yin no //
translated: Attachment exists without attachment,ğŸ”½what would be the point of this?

original: de la don cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la don cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What would be the point of this?

original: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and on the basis of that, it is said that â€œattachment exists.â€

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir chags pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir chags pa /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Attachment would exist on the basis of that.

original: chags pa 'di'i 'dod chags ni 'di'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chags pa 'di'i 'dod chags ni 'di'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It would be said that â€œthis is the attachment of this attached one.â€

original: pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bsam pa ltar brtag pa /ğŸ”½@94a * // gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
analyzed: pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bsam pa ltar brtag pa / @94a * // gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
translated: The refutation of attachment and one who is attachedğŸ”½If attachment existed prior to one who is attached,

analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //

original: zhes bya ba 'di las don cir 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa yod pa de la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe lhas byin ma chags pa chags par byed pa de'i tshe na 'dod chags zhes bya ste /

analyzed: 'o na de lta na 'dod chags med kyang de chags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags med pa'i snga rol na chags pa yod pa de ni tha snyad thams cad dang 'gal bas mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: 'on te 'dod chags kyi chags pa nyid du 'gyur bar byed na ni de lta na 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa yod par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags kyi chags pa nyid du 'gyur bar byed na ni de lta na 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa yod par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: But if you think that the one who is attached is the one who is made attached by attachment, then in that case you should not assert that the one who is attached exists prior to attachment.

original: de ltar @94b na 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi don las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa ni 'di lta ste zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de ltar @94b na 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi don las bzlog pas rjes su dpag pa ni 'di lta ste zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: In this case, because the word â€œisâ€ is an opportunity for analysis, the reverse of the implied meaning is to be applied, as follows.

original: glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i bsam pa ltar gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na chags pa yod par gyur cing chags pa de la brten nas 'dod chags yod par gyur na /

translated: Because the word â€œisâ€ is an opportunity for analysis, if the one who is attached existed prior to attachment and attachment existed in dependence on the one who is attached, as the opponent asserts, then the one who is attached would exist without attachment.

original: chags pa de la 'dod chags skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur bas zhes bya ba'i glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½skabs kyi don las bzlog pas zhes bya ba la skabs kyi don gang zhe na /
analyzed: chags pa de la 'dod chags skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur bas zhes bya ba'i glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro // skabs kyi don las bzlog pas zhes bya ba la skabs kyi don gang zhe na /
translated: â€œIt would be pointless for attachment to arise in one who is attachedâ€ is a statement that provides an opportunity.ğŸ”½â€œThe opposite of the meaning of the contextâ€ means the following.

original: glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i skabs kyi don te /
analyzed: glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i skabs kyi don te /
translated: The context is the meaning of the statement that provides an opportunity.

original: 'dod chags med kyang de chags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags med kyang de chags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: â€œEven without attachment, one would be attached.â€

original: de ni mi rung bas skabs kyi don de las bzlog pas don gzhan go bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas 'dir rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung bas skabs kyi don de las bzlog pas don gzhan go bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas 'dir rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba bya ste /
translated: Since that is unacceptable, the opposite of the meaning of the context is understood to be the other meaning.

original: 'dod chags med pa'i snga rol na chags pa nyid kyang med pas de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags skye ba yang med la /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i snga rol na chags pa nyid kyang med pas de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags skye ba yang med la /
translated: â€œBefore attachment, there is no one who is attached. Therefore, later, attachment does not arise in dependence on one who is attached.â€

original: 'dod chags med na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang de'i nyes dmigs bstan pa yang med pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub par ston to //
analyzed: 'dod chags med na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang de'i nyes dmigs bstan pa yang med pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs kyi don kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub par ston to //
translated: If there is no attachment, then there would be no affliction and no teaching of its disadvantages. Therefore, the meaning of the opponentâ€™s reason, â€œbecause of the teaching of affliction and disadvantages,â€ is unestablished.

original: chags pa ni 'dod chags med na mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: chags pa ni 'dod chags med na mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Attachment is a phenomenon that does not occur without attachment, because it is related to attachment, like the intrinsic nature of attachment itself. These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid med na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin pa de bzhin du chags pa yang 'dodğŸ”½chags la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid med na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin pa de bzhin du chags pa yang 'dod chags la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, the desirous one is also to depend on attachment.

original: 'dod chags med na mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags med na mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin no //
translated: If attachment does not exist, the desirous one would not arise.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags med pa'i snga rol na chags pa nyid kyang med pas de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags skye ba yang med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags med pa'i snga rol na chags pa nyid kyang med pas de la brten nas phyis 'dod chags skye ba yang med la /
translated: Therefore, since the desirous one does not exist prior to attachment, attachment does not arise later in dependence on it.

original: 'dod chags med na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang de'i nyes dmigs bstan pa yang med pas pha rol po'i gtan @95a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags med na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang de'i nyes dmigs bstan pa yang med pas pha rol po'i gtan @95a * //
translated: And if attachment does not exist, then the teaching of the faults of affliction and its faults would not exist.

original: tshigs kyi don kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshigs kyi don kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the verse is not established because it teaches the afflictions and their faults. Therefore, ultimately the aggregates, constituents, and bases do not exist.

translated: The reason that the lust of Devadatta is not the direct cause of the lust of YajÃ±adatta is because it is of a similar type to what is to be established.ğŸ”½The reason that the lust of YajÃ±adatta is not the direct cause of the lust of Devadatta is because it is of a dissimilar type to what is to be established.

translated: If attachment is established as a thing, then it is attachment because it causes attachment to a thing.

analyzed: dngos po ni gzhi la rag las pa'i phyir gzhi'i snga rol na med de zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /

translated: This is what is being said: Attachment, which is called a thing, is dependent. That to which it causes attachment is its basis. Since a thing is dependent on a basis, attachment that is dependent on it does not exist prior to the basis called that to which it causes attachment.

translated: For example, it is like the cooking that does not exist prior to the rice.ğŸ”½This is the example.ğŸ”½For example, cooking is the dependent and rice is the basis. Therefore, cooking does not exist prior to rice.

translated: Similarly, attachment is the dependent and one who is attached is the basis. Therefore, attachment does not exist prior to one who is attached.

analyzed: bzhin du chags pa med pa'i snga rol na 'dod chags yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ngo //

translated: And if attachment existed prior to one who is attached, then one who is attached would exist later, in dependence on that attachment that exists by its own intrinsic reality.

analyzed: de lta na gzhi'i snga rol na brten pa yod pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the error would ensue that that which is supported would exist prior to the basis.ğŸ”½That is unacceptable.

translated: Since that assertion that attachment exists prior to one who is attached contradicts all conventions, it is unacceptable.

translated: But if you assert that desire exists in dependence on one who is attached, then in that case you should not accept that desire exists prior to one who is attached.

translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate an example that is accepted in the world in relation to this very point, he says, â€œJust as the action of cooking does not occur without depending on that which is being cooked.â€

translated: For example, just as the action of cooking does not occur without depending on that which is being cooked, and just as the action of ripening does not occur without depending on that which is being ripened, in the same way, desire does not occur without depending on one who is attached.

original: de ltar na /

translated: Here, an inference is made:

If one who is attached does not exist, then the teaching of the thoroughly afflicted and its faults also do not exist. Therefore the meaning of the opponentâ€™s reason, â€œin order to teach the thoroughly afflicted and its faults,â€ is not established.

translated: Attachment is a phenomenon that does not occur without one who is attached. Because it is related, it is like the nature of one who is attached. These are the subject, the predicate, and the reason.

analyzed: de'i phyir chags pa med @100b pa'i snga rol na 'dod chags nyid kyang med pas de la brten nas phyis chags par 'gyur ba yang med la /
translated: Therefore, since attachment itself does not exist prior to the one who is attached, one who is attached does not exist later in dependence on that.ğŸ”½If the one who is attached does not exist, then the teaching of the affliction and its faults would not exist.

translated: Therefore, since the meaning of the opponentâ€™s reason, â€œin order to teach the affliction and its faults,â€ is not established, the reason is not established.

analyzed: don dam par phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dag yod pa ma yin no //

original: gal te pha med par yang bu la sogs pa yod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pağŸ”½nyid do zhes zer ba yin te /

translated: the opponent says that the Madhyamikaâ€™s reason, â€œbecause of dependence,â€ is not definite.

original: de dag na re 'jig rten na pha dang bu la sogs pa dag ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin yang pha shi 'am yul gzhan du song ste med pa'i phyin bu la sogs pa dag yod pa srid pa'i phyir des na ci re zhig ltos pa dang
analyzed: de dag na re 'jig rten na pha dang bu la sogs pa dag ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin yang pha shi 'am yul gzhan du song ste med pa'i phyin bu la sogs pa dag yod pa srid pa'i phyir des na ci re zhig ltos pa dang
translated: They say that in the world, fathers, sons, etc. are dependent, but it is possible for sons, etc. to exist when the father is dead or has gone to another country and is not there.

original: bcas pa'i phyir chags pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du chags pa med na 'dod chags mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bcas pa'i phyir chags pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin du chags pa med na 'dod chags mi 'byung ba'i tshul can yin par 'gyur ram /

analyzed: 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir pha med par yang bu la sogs pa yod pa srid pa lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is dependent, then like the son and so on, it is possible that the father exists without the son and so on.

original: de bas na khyed dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na khyed dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, your argument, O MÄdhyamika, is not established because it is dependent.

analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis / de nyid kyi phyir de yang bkag zin pas de ni mi gnod do zhes bya ba smras te ji ltar kho bos don dam par 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la snga phyi med par bkag pa de bzhin du pha dang bu la sogs pa dag la yang
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:ğŸ”½Because that has already been refuted, that is not a fault. Just as we have refuted the absence of sequence of attachment and one who is attached in the ultimate, so we have also refuted the absence of sequence of father and son and so on.

original: snga phyi med par bkag zin pas de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi klan ka de ni kho bo la mi gnod do //
analyzed: snga phyi med par bkag zin pas de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi klan ka de ni kho bo la mi gnod do //
translated: Therefore, since there is no countering position, it is not the case that our argument is not established. Thus your criticism does not affect us.

original: 'dod chags brtag pa'i mu gsum las 'dod chags chags pa'i snga rol na yod pa la brten nas chags pa yod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba mu dang po mi 'thad par bsgrubs zin te //

translated: The three alternatives of the analysis of attachment have already beenğŸ”½established as untenable, beginning with the first alternative, according toğŸ”½which attachment exists in dependence on the prior existence of the one who

original: da ni chags pa brtag pa'i mu gsum las 'dod chags pa chags pa bas phyis yod pa la brten nas chags pa @101a * //ğŸ”½yod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba mu gnyis pa mi 'thad par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni chags pa brtag pa'i mu gsum las 'dod chags pa chags pa bas phyis yod pa la brten nas chags pa @101a * // yod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba mu gnyis pa mi 'thad par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: is attached.

original: de'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
translated: Now, the second alternative, according to which the one who is attachedğŸ”½exists in dependence on the prior existence of attachment, will be shown toğŸ”½be untenable.ğŸ”½Here, someone might say that there is no error because it is maintained

original: 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can chags pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa med pa nyid chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: that the prior occurrence of the moment of attachment is the cause of theğŸ”½subsequent occurrence of the moment of the one who is attached.

original: 'dir ni phyogs snga ma smra ba dag 'dod chags chags pa pas phyis yod pa la brten nas chags pa yod par bsgrub ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni phyogs snga ma smra ba dag 'dod chags chags pa pas phyis yod pa la brten nas chags pa yod par bsgrub ste /
translated: Here the prior position is that attachment exists in dependence on the existence of one who is attached.

original: de dag na re kho bo cag ni 'dod chags yod pa la brten nas chags pa yod par 'dod pa rigs pa gang gis de ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: de dag na re kho bo cag ni 'dod chags yod pa la brten nas chags pa yod par 'dod pa rigs pa gang gis de ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: If you ask, â€œWhat is the logic by which we assert that one who is attached exists in dependence on attachment?â€

original: so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi rgyud la 'dod chags la sogs pa bag la nyal ba'i tshul du rang gi ngo bo gzung du med par yod pa nyid yin pas 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can gang la chags pa'i skad cig ma
analyzed: so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi rgyud la 'dod chags la sogs pa bag la nyal ba'i tshul du rang gi ngo bo gzung du med par yod pa nyid yin pas 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can gang la chags pa'i skad cig ma
translated: Since attachment and so on exist in the mindstreams of all ordinary beings in the manner of dormant tendencies, they exist in their essential nature without being apprehended.ğŸ”½Therefore, when the condition of attachment arises, it is asserted that one who is attached exists later.

original: phyis skye bar 'dod pa da dung med pa de nyid gang gi tshe rkyen rnyed nas gsal bar gyur pa de'i tshe na des chags par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: phyis skye bar 'dod pa da dung med pa de nyid gang gi tshe rkyen rnyed nas gsal bar gyur pa de'i tshe na des chags par 'gyur bas /
translated: When that which has not yet arisen becomes manifest, having obtained conditions, it becomes one who is attached.

original: 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can chags pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa med pa de nyid chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir khyod na re chags pa med par 'dod chags
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can chags pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa med pa de nyid chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir khyod na re chags pa med par 'dod chags
translated: Because you assert that the prior moment of attachment that exists at the time of the prior moment of desire is the cause of the later moment of attachment that arises at the time of the later moment of desire, you cannot say that desire exists without attachment.

original: yod par 'dod na gzhi med par bya ba yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i nyes pa de kho bo cag la med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yod par 'dod na gzhi med par bya ba yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i nyes pa de kho bo cag la med do zhes zer ro //
translated: If you assert that attachment exists without desire, then you would commit the error of asserting that an action exists without a basis.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid gyis  bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid gyis  bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains:

original: 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang //
analyzed: 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang //
translated: Even if attachment existed,

original: chags pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: chags pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could attachment exist?

original: zhes bya ba smras to /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras to /
translated: He says this.

original: khyed kyi 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang chags pa yod par nyid du ga la 'gyur te 'di ltar gal te 'dod chags yod na chags par 'gyur na chags pa de 'dod chags des chags par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyi 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang chags pa yod par nyid du ga la 'gyur te 'di ltar gal te 'dod chags yod na chags par 'gyur na chags pa de 'dod chags des chags par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: But even if your attachment existed, how could the one who is attached exist? In this way, if attachment existed, the one who is attached would exist. But the one who is attached does not exist due to that attachment.

original: chags pa ma yin na ni ji ltar chags par 'gyur ci ste 'gyur na ni nam yang chags pa ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: chags pa ma yin na ni ji ltar chags par 'gyur ci ste 'gyur na ni nam yang chags pa ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: If he is not attached, how could he be attached? But if he were, then he would never not be attached. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can @101b chags pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa med pa nyid ni chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can @101b chags pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa med pa nyid ni chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is untenable that the one who is attached, who is characterized by the prior occurrence of attachment, exists due to the desire for the arising of the one who is attached.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid de zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid de zhes bya ba smras te /

original: sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la brten pa'i 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma gang yin pa de ni sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma de nyid dang lhan cig tu 'gags pas 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can de chags pa'i skad
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la brten pa'i 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma gang yin pa de ni sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma de nyid dang lhan cig tu 'gags pas 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can de chags pa'i skad
translated: The moment of attachment that depends on the prior moment of mind ceases simultaneously with that prior moment of mind. Therefore, the prior moment of attachment that exists in the past is not the cause of the generation of the subsequent moment of attachment.

original: cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang chags pa yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags yod par gyur na yang chags pa yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, even if attachment exists, the attached one would not exist.

original: 'dir pha rol po dag na re 'o na de lta na chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ji ltar yod par 'gyur zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po dag na re 'o na de lta na chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ji ltar yod par 'gyur zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /

analyzed: 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma dus tha dad pa nyid kyis chags pa'i skad cig ma phyis 'byung ba chags pa nyid du byed par mi 'grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te / sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la brten pa'i 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma gang yin pa de ni sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma de nyid dang lhan cig tu 'gags pas 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma snga ma dus tha dad pa nyid kyis chags
translated: Because it is not established that the later moment of attachment is made attached by the very different moment of attachment.ğŸ”½The moment of attachment that is dependent on the prior moment of mind ceases together with just that prior moment of mind. Therefore, the later moment of attachment is not established to be made attached by the prior moment of attachment that is a different time.

original: pa'i skad cig ma phyis 'byung ba chags pa nyid du byed par ma grub pa'i phyir chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ni kun rdzob tsam du brjod par zad kyi don dam par yod pa ma yin no //

translated: Here, the opponent says: Just as the later moment of attachment arises from the earlier moment of attachment that is in the process of ceasing, that later moment of attachment causes the later moment of mind that arises at the same time as it to be attached.

original: byed pas 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can chags pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa med pa de nyid chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba
analyzed: byed pas 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma sngar byung ba'i tshul can chags pa'i skad cig ma skye bar 'dod pa med pa de nyid chags pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma skye bar 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba

analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /

analyzed: dper na tshos pa gzhan gyis gzhan tshos pa nyid du mi 'thad pa bzhin ta zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: don dam par da ltar gyi sems kyi skad cig ma ni da ltar nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the present moment of mind is not present,ğŸ”½because it is related to something else, like the past moment of attachment.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma bzhin no zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i 'dod chags kyi skad cig ma bzhin no zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //

analyzed: lhas byin gyi 'dod chags ni lhas byin chags pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin te /

analyzed: 'dod chags yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyud tha dad pa'i 'dod chags bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
