analyzed: 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa dang / gzhan yang mar me dang 'od dag kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa yang yin la /
translated: Moreover, a lamp and its light are related,

original: de dag la ltan cig gi dngos po yang yod pas des na ci ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po med par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de dag la ltan cig gi dngos po yang yod pas des na ci ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po med par 'gyur ram /
translated: but they also exist simultaneously. Therefore, how could attachment and one who is attached not exist simultaneously because they are related, like a seed and its sprout?

original: 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mar me dang 'od dag bzhin 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'gyur ba yang ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mar me dang 'od dag bzhin 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'gyur ba yang ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: But if you say that attachment and one who is attached exist simultaneously because they are related, like a lamp and its light, then that is also indefinite.

original: gal te brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhe na yang ba lang gi rva lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis la yang 'di ni g-yon pa'o 'di ni g-yas pa'o zhes brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa mthong bas de lta
analyzed: gal te brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhe na yang ba lang gi rva lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis la yang 'di ni g-yon pa'o 'di ni g-yas pa'o zhes brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa mthong bas de lta
translated: But if you say that because it is dependent on the positing of a special expression, then since it is seen that a special expression is posited for the two horns of an ox, saying, This is the left, this is the right,ğŸ”½then in that case, it is still not established.

original: na yang ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te khyed dbu ma pa dag brjod pa khyad par can bstan pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lhan cig gi dngos po med do zhes bya bar sgrub na ni des kyang khyed kyi gtanğŸ”½tshigs @104b ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: na yang ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te khyed dbu ma pa dag brjod pa khyad par can bstan pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lhan cig gi dngos po med do zhes bya bar sgrub na ni des kyang khyed kyi gtanğŸ”½tshigs @104b ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: If you Madhyamikas prove that coexistent things do not exist because they are dependent on the positing of a special expression, then that reason, because it is dependent, is not established for you.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na ba lang gi rva lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis la yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i dbang gis 'di ni g-yon pa'o 'di ni g-yas pa'o zhes brjod pa khyad par can bstan pa mthong bas des na ci ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sağŸ”½bon dang myu gu dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po med par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na ba lang gi rva lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis la yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i dbang gis 'di ni g-yon pa'o 'di ni g-yas pa'o zhes brjod pa khyad par can bstan pa mthong bas des na ci ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po med par 'gyur ram /
translated: Thus, in the world, the two horns of an ox that arise simultaneously are said to be distinct, in dependence on the power of their relation, one is called the left horn and the other is called the right horn.ğŸ”½Therefore, since they are related, are desire and the desirous one like a seed and a sprout, which do not exist simultaneously?

original: 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ba lang gi rva dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ba lang gi rva dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Or, since they are related, are desire and the desirous one like the two horns of an ox, which exist simultaneously?

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Since it is uncertain, your reason, â€œbecause they are related,â€ is indeterminate and thus unacceptable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis tshogs pa'i dbang po kho na las sems dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dag dang mar me 'od dang bcas pa dag 'byung bas tha snyad du yang lhan cig gi dngos por khas
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis tshogs pa'i dbang po kho na las sems dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dag dang mar me 'od dang bcas pa dag 'byung bas tha snyad du yang lhan cig gi dngos por khas
translated: In response to that, the author of this commentary says that because the mind and mental factors arise from the sense faculties alone, and because a lamp and its light arise from the assembly of its parts, he does not accept that they are simultaneous even conventionally.

original: ma blangs pa'i phyir dang ba lang gi rva gnyis kyang don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir ci skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma blangs pa'i phyir dang ba lang gi rva gnyis kyang don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir ci skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: And because the two horns of a cow are not ultimately established, the fault stated by the opponent does not apply to him.

original: skye ba dang brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa de dag la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni yod la lhan cig gi dngos po ni med pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs don dang mthun pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba
analyzed: skye ba dang brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa de dag la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni yod la lhan cig gi dngos po ni med pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs don dang mthun pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba
translated: He says that although they are dependent on the special arising and expression that are posited in dependence on them, they are not simultaneous. Therefore, since his reason is consistent with the meaning, his reason is not inconclusive because it is dependent.

original: de'i don ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i don ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the meaning of his reason is not indeterminate.

original: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang rang gi len pa'i rgyu mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa'i tshogs pa ci rigs pa'i dbang kho na las 'byung bas rang rang gi len pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcasğŸ”½pa yin pa'i phyir de dag len pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pas de dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang khas ma blangs ba'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang
analyzed: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang rang gi len pa'i rgyu mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa'i tshogs pa ci rigs pa'i dbang kho na las 'byung bas rang rang gi len pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de dag len pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pas de dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang khas ma blangs ba'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang
translated: Thus, since minds and mental factors arise only due to the power of the assembly of their appropriating causesâ€”the eye, form, light, space and attentionâ€”they are dependent on their own appropriating causes.ğŸ”½Since they are not coemergent causes in terms of their appropriating causes, the existence of minds and mental factors as coemergent things is not accepted even conventionally.

original: rang rang gi len pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin du de dag lhan cig gi dngos po med la /
analyzed: rang rang gi len pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin du de dag lhan cig gi dngos po med la /
translated: Therefore, like seeds and sprouts, minds and mental factors do not exist as coemergent things because they are dependent on their own appropriating causes.

original: mar me dang 'od dag kyang rang rang gi len pa'i rgyu 'bru mar dang snying po dang gong bu la sogs pa tshogs pa'i dbang kho @105a * //
analyzed: mar me dang 'od dag kyang rang rang gi len pa'i rgyu 'bru mar dang snying po dang gong bu la sogs pa tshogs pa'i dbang kho @105a * //
translated: Also, the light and the flame arise from the power of the assembly of their respective substantial causes, such as the wick, the heart of the flame, and the vessel,

original: na las 'byung bas rang rang gi len pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de dag kyang len pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pas de dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par kun rdzob kyi tha
analyzed: na las 'byung bas rang rang gi len pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de dag kyang len pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pas de dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par kun rdzob kyi tha
translated: and because they are related to their respective substantial causes, they are not coemergent causes in terms of their substantial causes. Therefore, in terms of the conventional, we do not accept that they are coemergent things.

original: snyad du yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir mar me dang 'od dag kyang rang rang gi len pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin du de dag la yang lhan cig gi dngos po med pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi
analyzed: snyad du yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir mar me dang 'od dag kyang rang rang gi len pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin du de dag la yang lhan cig gi dngos po med pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi
translated: Also, because the light and the flame are related to their respective substantial causes, like the seed and sprout, they are not coemergent things.

original: don skye ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lhan cig gi dngos po med do zhes bsgrubs na yang dper na sa bon dang myu gu dag ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de dag la lhan cig gi dngos po med pa de bzhin du 'dod chags dangğŸ”½chags pa dag kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de dag la yang lhan cig gi dngos po med do zhes bya ba dang mthun pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: don skye ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lhan cig gi dngos po med do zhes bsgrubs na yang dper na sa bon dang myu gu dag ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de dag la lhan cig gi dngos po med pa de bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de dag la yang lhan cig gi dngos po med do zhes bya ba dang mthun pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If you prove that they do not exist simultaneously because they are related to arising, then it would be similar to the example of a seed and a sprout, which do not exist simultaneously because they are related.ğŸ”½But it is not indeterminate because it is similar to the statement: â€œDesire and the desirous one do not exist simultaneously because they are related.â€

original: ba lang gi rva lta bu brjod pa khyad par can bstan pa dag ni kho bo'i phyogs la don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir kho bo 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de dag la don dam par lhan cig gi dngos po
analyzed: ba lang gi rva lta bu brjod pa khyad par can bstan pa dag ni kho bo'i phyogs la don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir kho bo 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de dag la don dam par lhan cig gi dngos po
translated: The statements that are special expressions, like â€œthe horns of a rabbit,â€ are not established ultimately in our system. Therefore, we assert that desire and the desirous one do not exist simultaneously ultimately because they are related.

original: med par sgrub pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ba lang gi rva dag med pas des na ci ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po med par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: med par sgrub pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ba lang gi rva dag med pas des na ci ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po med par 'gyur ram /
translated: Since the horns of a rabbit do not exist, is the state of simultaneity of attachment and one who is attached like a seed and a sprout, which do have a basis of dependence, or is the state of simultaneity of attachment and one who is attached like the horns of a rabbit, which do not have a basis of dependence?

original: 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ba lang gi rva dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i ma nges pa nyid med do //
analyzed: 'on te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ba lang gi rva dag bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i ma nges pa nyid med do //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that this reason is indeterminate.

original: ji skad smras ba'i skyon med do zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji skad smras ba'i skyon med do zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no fault in what has been said, that is, this reason is not indeterminate.

original: yang gzhan yang 'di la 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag gam tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag na re gang dag lhan cig nyid
analyzed: yang gzhan yang 'di la 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag gam tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po dag na re gang dag lhan cig nyid
translated: Moreover, here, are attachment and one who is attached imagined to be the same and coexistent, or are they imagined to be different and coexistent?ğŸ”½The opponent says that those attachment and one who is attached that are coexistent

original: do zhes zer ba'i 'dod chags dang chags pa de dag gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag gam tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag grang na de gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: do zhes zer ba'i 'dod chags dang chags pa de dag gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag gam tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du brtag grang na de gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: are either imagined to be the same and coexistent, or imagined to be different and coexistent. But both of those are untenable.

original: de dag la re zhig gal te gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du rtog na de yang mi rung ste ci'i @105b phyir zhe na /ğŸ”½gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
analyzed: de dag la re zhig gal te gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du rtog na de yang mi rung ste ci'i @105b phyir zhe na / gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
translated: In this regard, first, if they are imagined to be the same and coexistent, that is also untenable. Why?ğŸ”½One is not coexistent.

original: zhes bya ba smras te re zhig gcig pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te re zhig gcig pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: If they are the same, co-existence is untenable.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba ni //
translated: That is the thesis.

original: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
analyzed: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
translated: One is not coexistent with itself.ğŸ”½

original: zhes bya ba de ni re zhig gcig pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid mi 'thad par dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni re zhig gcig pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid mi 'thad par dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The statement, â€œOne is not simultaneous with itself,â€ is the statement of the thesis that simultaneity is not tenable if there is oneness.

original: de yi bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir //ğŸ”½de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
analyzed: de yi bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir // de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
translated: In order to demonstrate the proof of that,

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: he says, â€œThat itself is not simultaneous with that.â€

original: lhan cig nyid ni gnyis las yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni //ğŸ”½de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
analyzed: lhan cig nyid ni gnyis las yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni // de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
translated: The meaning is that simultaneity exists only in the case of two things.

original: zhes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa de'i ldog pa bstan pa'i tshig yin te /ğŸ”½yang 'jig rten la grags pa'i tshul ltar bya na yang lhan cig nyid ni /
analyzed: zhes rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa de'i ldog pa bstan pa'i tshig yin te / yang 'jig rten la grags pa'i tshul ltar bya na yang lhan cig nyid ni /
translated: The statement, â€œThat itself is not simultaneous with that,â€ is the statement of the reverse pervasion that demonstrates the forward pervasion.

original: dngos po gnyis la yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos po gnyis la yod pa'i phyir //
translated: If one acts in accordance with the way things are known in the world, simultaneity exists only in the case of two things.

original: 'di na ba lang gcig pu zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid de ba lang gcig cig la snyegs so //
analyzed: 'di na ba lang gcig pu zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid de ba lang gcig cig la snyegs so //
translated: Here, the statement, â€œOne cow,â€ refers to the oneness of a single cow.

original: de la ba lang gcig pu de nyid ba lang gcig pu de nyid dang ji ltar lhan cig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ba lang gcig pu de nyid ba lang gcig pu de nyid dang ji ltar lhan cig tu 'gyur te /
translated: How could that very single ox be simultaneous with that very single ox?

original: de'i phyir gcig pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, if it is the same, simultaneity is untenable.

original: des na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, this is also a statement of an example that has a similar quality.

original: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //ğŸ”½zhes smos pa'i sgrub pa des na tshig de ni 'dir gcig pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de nyid de dang lhan cig min // zhes smos pa'i sgrub pa des na tshig de ni 'dir gcig pa nyid yin na /
translated: That very thing is not simultaneous with itself.

original: lhan cig nyid mi 'thad par sgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig kyang yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig nyid mi 'thad par sgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig kyang yin te /
translated: By that proof, that statement is also a statement of an example that has a similar quality, proving that if it is the same, simultaneity is untenable.

original: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis bstan dgos pas /
analyzed: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis bstan dgos pas /
translated: Because an example must be stated in terms of the qualities of the probandum and the proof,

original: 'dir 'dod chags de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid la sogs pa gang la bsgrub par bya ba chos lhan cig nyid du mi skye ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dag yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod chags de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid la sogs pa gang la bsgrub par bya ba chos lhan cig nyid du mi skye ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dag yod pa yin no //
translated: here the example is the statement â€œDesire is not simultaneously generated with itself, etc.,â€ because the probandum is the quality of simultaneity and the proof is the quality of being the same.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni 'dod chags ni chags pa dang lhan cig nyid du mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni 'dod chags ni chags pa dang lhan cig nyid du mi skye ste /
translated: Here, the inference is: Desire does not arise simultaneously with one who is desirous,ğŸ”½because it is the same as itself, for example, just as desire itself does not arise simultaneously with itself.

original: gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /ğŸ”½dper na 'dod chags de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid ni gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod @106a * //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na 'dod chags de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid ni gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod @106a * //
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proving property, the example of the similar class, and the conclusion are to be applied in order.ğŸ”½For example, just as the self of desire itself does not arise simultaneously with desire itself because it is the same as itself,

original: chags de nyid dang lhan cig nyid du mi skye ba de bzhin du 'dod chags kyang gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir chags pa dang lhan cig nyid du mi skye'o //
analyzed: chags de nyid dang lhan cig nyid du mi skye ba de bzhin du 'dod chags kyang gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir chags pa dang lhan cig nyid du mi skye'o //
translated: in the same way, desire does not arise simultaneously with one who is desirous because it is the same as itself.

original: gal te slob dpon gyis yan lag rdzogs par ma brjod pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re slob dpon btsun pa klu sgrub kyis /
analyzed: gal te slob dpon gyis yan lag rdzogs par ma brjod pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re slob dpon btsun pa klu sgrub kyis /
translated: then the opponent says, â€œThe master, the venerable Nagarjuna,

original: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
analyzed: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
translated: stated, â€˜One thing is not coexistent,

original: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
analyzed: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
translated: that itself is not coexistent with itself.â€™

original: zhes smras pa de la phyogs dang dpe yod du zin kyang gtan tshigs med pas de'i phyir sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes smras pa de la phyogs dang dpe yod du zin kyang gtan tshigs med pas de'i phyir sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Although he has a position and an example, he has no reason. Therefore, the fault of incomplete proof exists.â€

original: de skad ces zer na de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer na de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says,

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te slob dpon gyi tshig dag don gyi tshig yin pa'i phyir dang / don gyi tshig dag gis ni don chen po dag skyed par byed de tshig nyung ngu nyid yin yang sbyor ba'i tshig du ma dag 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te slob dpon gyi tshig dag don gyi tshig yin pa'i phyir dang / don gyi tshig dag gis ni don chen po dag skyed par byed de tshig nyung ngu nyid yin yang sbyor ba'i tshig du ma dag 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: â€œThat is not good, because the words of the master are words of meaning and words of meaning generate great meaning, because even though they are few words, many words of application are established.â€

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas ni mdo mdzad pa yin la mdo ni don smos pa tsam yin pa'i phyir dang / don smos pa tsam gyi tshig dag gis ni sbyor ba'i tshig du ma dag 'grub pa'i phyir khyed kyi klan ka de bzang po ma yin no //ğŸ”½'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re 'grel pa byed pa khyod nyid kyang sbyor ba'i tshig dag smra ba yin pas sgrub pa'i yan lag gi rgyus shes bzhin du phyogs su ltung ba'i dbang gis slob dpon gyis kha 'dzin pa ni mi rigs pa yin no
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas ni mdo mdzad pa yin la mdo ni don smos pa tsam yin pa'i phyir dang / don smos pa tsam gyi tshig dag gis ni sbyor ba'i tshig du ma dag 'grub pa'i phyir khyed kyi klan ka de bzang po ma yin no // 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re 'grel pa byed pa khyod nyid kyang sbyor ba'i tshig dag smra ba yin pas sgrub pa'i yan lag gi rgyus shes bzhin du phyogs su ltung ba'i dbang gis slob dpon gyis kha 'dzin pa ni mi rigs pa yin no
translated: The master's own words are the sutra, and since the sutra merely mentions the meaning, and since many of the words of the sutra are established by the mere mention of the meaning, your criticism is not good.ğŸ”½Here, if the opponent says, You, the commentator, are also speaking the words of the syllogism, so it is not right for you to take the master's side out of partiality, knowing the reason for the incomplete syllogism,

original: zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas 'byung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis sbyor ba'i tshig dag la ni ma tshang ba nyid du yang ma 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas 'byung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis sbyor ba'i tshig dag la ni ma tshang ba nyid du yang ma 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: in response to this opponent's position that arises from within, it is said here by the commentator himself that the words of the syllogism are not incomplete.

original: 'grel pa byed pa dag gi sbyor ba'i tshig dag la ni gal te phyogs dang dpe yod kyang gtan tshigs med na sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid du yang 'gyur ba bden na kho bos ni sngar 'dod chags ni chags pa dang lhan cig nyid du mi skye
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa dag gi sbyor ba'i tshig dag la ni gal te phyogs dang dpe yod kyang gtan tshigs med na sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid du yang 'gyur ba bden na kho bos ni sngar 'dod chags ni chags pa dang lhan cig nyid du mi skye
translated: Desire does not arise simultaneously with one who is desirous,ğŸ”½because it is one with that person, like the desireâ€™s own nature.

original: ste gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes yan lag rdzogs par brjod pa'i phyir kho bo la ni sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon med do //
analyzed: ste gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags de nyid kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do zhes yan lag rdzogs par brjod pa'i phyir kho bo la ni sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of my proof being incomplete.

original: yang na mi 'gyur te de la yang gang gi tshe rab tu byed pa 'am grub pa'i mtha' las cung zad la la la grags pa yin na'o zhes bya ba ni yang na 'grel @106b pa byed pa dag gi sbyor ba'i tshig dag la yang gal te yan
analyzed: yang na mi 'gyur te de la yang gang gi tshe rab tu byed pa 'am grub pa'i mtha' las cung zad la la la grags pa yin na'o zhes bya ba ni yang na 'grel @106b pa byed pa dag gi sbyor ba'i tshig dag la yang gal te yan
translated: Or, it is not so, because even in that case, if the subject is known to some in the treatise or in the tenets, then the reason is stated.

original: lag rdzogs par ma brjod na yang sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon du mi 'gyur te de dag gi sbyor ba'i tshig de la yang gang gi tshe rab tu byed pa'i skabs sam lung gi grub pa'i mtha' las phyogs sam dpe 'am gtan tshigs cung zad
analyzed: lag rdzogs par ma brjod na yang sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon du mi 'gyur te de dag gi sbyor ba'i tshig de la yang gang gi tshe rab tu byed pa'i skabs sam lung gi grub pa'i mtha' las phyogs sam dpe 'am gtan tshigs cung zad
translated: Even if the reason is not explicitly stated, there is no fault of the proof being incomplete, because in the context of the treatise or in the tenets of the scriptures, the words of the syllogism are understood.ğŸ”½

original: cig rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba la la la grags pa yin na de'i tshe yan lag rdzogs par ma brjod kyang sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba la la la grags pa yin na de'i tshe yan lag rdzogs par ma brjod kyang sgrub pa ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if you do not state the complete syllogism, the fault of not stating the complete proof is not committed, because when the words of the syllogism are stated, if the subject, reason, or example is slightly known to the opponent, then even if the syllogism is not stated in complete form, the fault of not stating the complete proof is not committed.

original: de ltar re zhig 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid yin na lhan cig pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid yin na lhan cig pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, first, if attachment and one who is attached are identical, simultaneity is not tenable.

original: ci ste tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du rtog na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ci ste tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du rtog na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: But if you imagine that they are simultaneous even though they are different, that also is not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'gal ba med pa'i gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'gal ba med pa'i gcig pa nyid la lhan cig nyid med pa de'i tshe /
translated: Even if they are not mutually exclusive, they are not simultaneous.

original: ci ste tha dad nyid yin na //
analyzed: ci ste tha dad nyid yin na //
translated: But if they are different,

original: lhan cig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: lhan cig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could they be coexistent?

analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te ci ste tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid du rtog na de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'jig rten la gcig pa nyid dang lhan cig nyid ces bya ba don 'gal ba med pa'i phyogs la yang ji skad bstan pa'i tshul
translated: If you imagine that they are coexistent while being different, then even in that case, when one examines whether the meaning of â€œsamenessâ€ and â€œcoexistenceâ€ are mutually exclusive, as was explained earlier,

analyzed: gyis brtags na lhan cig nyid med pa de'i tshe ci ste tha dad pa nyid yin na lhan cig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: if they are not coexistent, then how could they be different?

analyzed: 'dir tha dad nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni lhan cig nyid yin na mi mthun pa de gnyis gcig na ji ltar lhan cig gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the antithesis of difference is coexistence. If those two antitheses are in one thing, how could they coexist?

analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa nyid yin na yang lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, even if they are different, it is untenable that they are coexistent.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this point, he says:

original: tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /

translated: Because it would be undermined by inference, and because there is no inference that demonstrates that difference itself exists as coexistent.

analyzed: dbu ma pa la tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod pa ma yin par dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod pa'i phyir dang / pha rol po la tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid yin na yang lhan cig nyid mi 'thad do zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: The author of the sÅ«tra intended to say that because the Madhyamaka has an inference that refutes the existence of difference itself as coexistent, and because the opponent has no inference that demonstrates that difference itself exists as coexistent, it is untenable that difference itself exists as coexistent.

original: 'di yang dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: ci ste tha dad nyid yin na //
analyzed: ci ste tha dad nyid yin na //
translated: If they are different,

analyzed: lhan cig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could they be coexistent?

translated: This is also a statement of the thesis that if they are different, then simultaneity is untenable.ğŸ”½The property of the subject is that difference is not simultaneous.

original: phyogs kyi chos ni tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid med pas phyogs brtag pa las tha dad pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dir tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ni thağŸ”½dad pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos ni tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid med pas phyogs brtag pa las tha dad pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dir tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ni tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The reason is that difference is from the perspective of the thesis.

translated: That is also the reason that is different from the perspective of the thesis, because difference is not simultaneous was previously stated in the context of positing the thesis.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

translated: For example, it is like impermanence because of being produced.

analyzed: dper na bum pa byas pa mi rtag par dam bca' ba'i phyogs nye bar gzhag pa de las brtags na de'i phyogs kyi chos byas pa nyid yin par shes pa de bzhin du 'dir yang tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig nyid med par dam bca' ba'i phyogs
translated: For example, when one analyzes the position that the pot is impermanent because it is produced, one understands that the property of that position is just being produced.

analyzed: nye bar gzhag pa de las brtags na de'i phyogs kyi chos tha dad pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, here one should understand that the property of the position that difference does not exist for co-existenceğŸ”½is just difference.

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir smra bar 'dod pa'i don bstan pa'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, here the inference should be stated in this way, in accordance with the meaning that is intended to be expressed.

translated: In reality, attachment and one who is attached are not coexistent because they are different, like attachment and one who is free from attachment.

translated: This is the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example that illustrates the property of the subject, respectively.

analyzed: dper na 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir de dag la lhan cig nyid med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, attachment and one who is free from attachment are not coexistent because they are different.ğŸ”½In the same way, attachment and one who is attached are not coexistent because they are different.

translated: This inference undermines the opponentâ€™s argument.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gal te gcig @107b pu lhan cig na //
analyzed: gal te gcig @107b pu lhan cig na //
translated: If a single thing were coexistent,

analyzed: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba ni yang gal te 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid kyang yin la /
translated: It would be so even without a companion.ğŸ”½If you imagine that attachment and one who is attached are the same and also coexistent,

analyzed: lhan cig nyid du yang rtog na grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid ces bya ba der 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //

analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid du zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The context is that attachment and one who is attached are coexistent.

original: gal te gcig pu lhan cig na //
analyzed: gal te gcig pu lhan cig na //
translated: If the one is coexistent,

original: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be so even without a companion.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gal te gcig pa nyid kyang yin la lhan cig nyid du yang 'dod na /
translated: If you imagine that attachment and one who is attached are the same and also coexistent,

original: de dag grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid ces bya ba der 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: de dag grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid ces bya ba der 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: it would be so even without a companion.ğŸ”½The context is that attachment and one who is attached are coexistent.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag grogs med par lhan cig nyid du mi 'dod de zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag grogs med par lhan cig nyid du mi 'dod de zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: We do not accept that attachment and one who is attached are coexistent without a companion.ğŸ”½This is the thesis.

original: 'dis ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gi lhan cig nyid dgag par bya ba'i chos ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang bstan to zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'i phyogs des ni sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gi lhan cig nyid dgag par bya ba'i chos ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang bstan to zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'i phyogs des ni sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid
translated: This also teaches that the object of negation, the simultaneity of attachment and one who is attached, is a dependent phenomenon.

analyzed: kyang bstan pa yin no // de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid ni lhan cig nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is the thesis.ğŸ”½The reason is: â€œBecause it is a dependent phenomenon.â€

analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The example is: â€œFor example, like the intrinsic reality of attachment.â€ğŸ”½The subject, predicate, reason, and example are applied in order.

analyzed: dper na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dag gcig pa nyid dang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lhan cig nyid ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, attachment and one who is attached do not exist simultaneously because they are related as one.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

analyzed: ba lang la yang snyegs rta la yang snyegs pas gang dang gang na gcig pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig nyid yod cing /
translated: are applied to a cow and applied to a horse, respectively. Therefore, wherever one exists, there co-existence exists.

analyzed: ba lang gcig pu nyid dang rta gcig pu nyid la grogs med par yang lhan cig nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur te /

original: de lta na lhan cig nyid du brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta ni /
analyzed: de lta na lhan cig nyid du brtag pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta ni /
translated: If that were so, it would be pointless to investigate coexistent things.ğŸ”½This is how the elder Buddhapalita explains the half-verse:

original: gal te gcig pu lhan cig na //

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bstan pa de la khyed zhe 'gras pa'i blos kyang kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma grub pa nyid du brtag par mi nus pas khyod kyi rtog pa de mi
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bstan pa de la khyed zhe 'gras pa'i blos kyang kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma grub pa nyid du brtag par mi nus pas khyod kyi rtog pa de mi
translated: Therefore your conception isğŸ”½improper.

original: rung ngo // gzhan yang kho bos /ğŸ”½gal ta 'dod chags snga ral na //
analyzed: rung ngo // gzhan yang kho bos / gal ta 'dod chags snga ral na //
translated: Moreover, we have said:ğŸ”½If attachment existed earlier,

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la tha dad pa nyid mi srid par bstan pa dang / khyod kyis 'dod chags dang chags pa dag rab tu sgrub pa'i @110a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na // zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dod chags dang chags pa dag la tha dad pa nyid mi srid par bstan pa dang / khyod kyis 'dod chags dang chags pa dag rab tu sgrub pa'i @110a * //
translated: then one would be attached without attachment.ğŸ”½And so on. This teaches that it is impossible for attachment and one who is attached to be different.

original: phyir de gnyis lhan cig nyid la brten to //
analyzed: phyir de gnyis lhan cig nyid la brten to //
translated: You say that attachment and one who is attached are established because they are mutually dependent.

original: de la yang kho bos /
analyzed: de la yang kho bos /
translated: But we have said:

original: 'dod chags dang ni chags pa dag //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ni chags pa dag //
translated: Attachment and one who is attached

original: lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
analyzed: lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
translated: It is illogical that they would arise simultaneously.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag ste /
translated: Thus it is refuted.

original: lhan cig nyid de yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: lhan cig nyid de yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi 'dod pas /
translated: Since you do not assert that simultaneity is dependent,ğŸ”½you assert that they are one.

original: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
analyzed: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de //
translated: But one is not simultaneous with itself.

original: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //ğŸ”½zhes bya bas gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir lhan cig nyid bkag pa dang / yang khyod kyis de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid de dang lhan cig min // zhes bya bas gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir lhan cig nyid bkag pa dang / yang khyod kyis de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: That itself is not simultaneous with itself.ğŸ”½Since you assert that they are one, simultaneity is refuted.

original: tha dad pa nyid du khas blangs pas /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du khas blangs pas /
translated: Moreover, in order to establish that, you assert that they are different.

original: tha dad sgrub par ma gyur pas //
analyzed: tha dad sgrub par ma gyur pas //
translated: But since they are not established as different,

original: de phyir lhan cig 'dod byed dam //
analyzed: de phyir lhan cig 'dod byed dam //
translated: why do you assert that they are simultaneous?

original: lhan cig rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lhan cig rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: Or, in order to establish simultaneity,

original: tha dad nyid du yang 'dod dam //
analyzed: tha dad nyid du yang 'dod dam //
translated: do you assert that they are different?

original: zhes bya ba dag gis ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad pa nyid du ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir grub par ma gyur pas de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir lhan cig nyid du 'dod par byed la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag gis ni 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad pa nyid du ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir grub par ma gyur pas de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir lhan cig nyid du 'dod par byed la /
translated: Since attachment and one who is attached are not established as different because there is no need for them to be different, in order to establish that, you assert that they are simultaneous.

original: lhan cig nyid du yang gcig pa nyid kyi skyon chags pa'i phyir ma grub pas de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhan cig nyid du yang gcig pa nyid kyi skyon chags pa'i phyir ma grub pas de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the error of identity would ensue if they were simultaneous, they are not established.ğŸ”½

original: tha dad pa nyid du yang 'dod par byed pa khyod ni gos ngan pa lhags pa chen pos nyen pa ba skums pa yang brnag mi bzod pa yang rkyong bar byed pa dang 'dra'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du yang 'dod par byed pa khyod ni gos ngan pa lhags pa chen pos nyen pa ba skums pa yang brnag mi bzod pa yang rkyong bar byed pa dang 'dra'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Since it is not established because the error of identity is incurred even in co-presence, in order to establish that, you assert co-presence even in difference. You are like one who, unable to bear the cold, draws in his thin blanket even more.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: When,

original: tha dad dngos po ma grub pas //
analyzed: tha dad dngos po ma grub pas //
translated: since the entity of difference is not established,

original: lhan cig dngos po 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: lhan cig dngos po 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: the entity of co-presence is not established,

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa /
translated: then, Venerable One,

original: tha dad dngos po gang zhig la //
analyzed: tha dad dngos po gang zhig la //
translated: what entity of difference

original: lhan cig dngos por 'dod par byed //
analyzed: lhan cig dngos por 'dod par byed //
translated: do you assert as the entity of co-presence?

original: de je smros shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de je smros shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: Speak!

original: 'di ltar khyod ni tha dad pa'i dngos po yod na de gnyis kyi lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'dod na tha dad pa'i dngos po de yang rnam pa thams cad du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod ni tha dad pa'i dngos po yod na de gnyis kyi lhan cig gi dngos po yod par 'dod na tha dad pa'i dngos po de yang rnam pa thams cad du mi 'grub po //
translated: Thus, if you assert that the entity of co-presence exists when the entity of difference exists, then that entity of difference is not established in any way.

original: tha dad pa'i dngos po med na khyod kyi lhan cig gi dngos po yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i dngos po med na khyod kyi lhan cig gi dngos po yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If there is no different thing, how could your coexistent thing exist?

original: 'o na tha dad pa'i dngos po gang zhig yod na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig gi dngos por 'dod pa de je smros shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'o na tha dad pa'i dngos po gang zhig yod na 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig gi dngos por 'dod pa de je smros shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Now state what that different thing is, the existence of which you assert that attachment and one who is attached exist as coexistent things.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ci rim gyis skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa la'am 'on te lhan cig skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa la lhan cig gi dngos por 'dod par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ci rim gyis skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa la'am 'on te lhan cig skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa la lhan cig gi dngos por 'dod par byed de /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, â€œDo you assert that they exist as coexistent things in regard to the difference that arises sequentially or in regard to the difference that arises simultaneously?â€

original: de la gal te rim gyis skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid la zhes byar ni @110b mi 'thad de //
analyzed: de la gal te rim gyis skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid la zhes byar ni @110b mi 'thad de //
translated: If you assert that they exist as coexistent things in regard to the difference that arises sequentially, that is untenable.

original: de ni tha dad pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag bzhin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ni tha dad pa'i phyir dper na 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag bzhin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Because that has been previously explained as follows: â€œBecause they are different, like attachment and one freed from attachment.â€

original: 'on te lhan cig ste skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid la'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig ste skye ba'i tha dad pa nyid la'o zhe na /
translated: If you assert that they exist as coexistent things in regard to the difference that arises simultaneously,

original: de yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag bzhin no zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de yang ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag bzhin no zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Moreover, because they are dependent, they are like cause and effect. This has been explained previously.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin par grub pa med pa de'i phyir mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dod chags dang chags pa dag lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin par grub pa med pa de'i phyir mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: Since in this way attachment and one who is attached are not established as being either simultaneous or not simultaneous, therefore we conclude:ğŸ”½Thus attachment and one who is attached

original: de ltar 'dod chags chags pa dang // lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags chags pa dang // lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
translated: Are not established as being simultaneous or not simultaneous.

original: dpyad pa sngar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar te mjug bsdu'o zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
analyzed: dpyad pa sngar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar te mjug bsdu'o zhes bya ba ni / gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
translated: The conclusion should be applied as it was explained in the previous analysis.ğŸ”½If prior to attachment

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
translated: One who is attached exists without attachment,

original: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod //
translated: Then attachment would exist in dependence on that.

original: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
translated: If one who is attached exists, attachment would exist.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpyad pa gang dag sngar bstan pa de dag gis de ltar 'dod chags ni chags pa dang lhan cig gi  ma chags pa med par yang 'grub pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dpyad pa gang dag sngar bstan pa de dag gis de ltar 'dod chags ni chags pa dang lhan cig gi  ma chags pa med par yang 'grub pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: As such, since attachment is not established as simultaneous with or not simultaneous with one who is attached, it is not established without one who is attached.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: This concludes the chapter on attachment and one who is attached.

original: ji ltar bstan pa'i tshul bzhin du chos thams cad kyang lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin par 'grub pa med pa nges par bzung ste 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa'i tshul bzhin du chos thams cad kyang lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin par 'grub pa med pa nges par bzung ste 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as attachment is not established as simultaneous or not simultaneous, all phenomena are also ascertained as not established as simultaneous or not simultaneous.ğŸ”½In order to teach this in a way that is similar to the above, the text says:

original: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun /
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun /
translated: Just like attachment, all phenomena

original: lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
analyzed: lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
translated: Are not established as simultaneous or not simultaneous.

original: 'dod chags bzhin du zhe sdang dang // gti mug la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad kyang lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin par yang 'grub pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du zhe sdang dang // gti mug la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad kyang lhan cig nyid dang lhan cig nyid ma yin par yang 'grub pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Just like attachment, all phenomenaâ€”outer and inner, such as anger, delusion, and so onâ€”are not established as simultaneous or not simultaneous.

original: ci ltar 'dod chags chags pa dang lhan cig gam chags pa med par yang 'grub pa med pa de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad kyang chos 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig gam lhan cig ma yin par yangğŸ”½'grub pa med do /
analyzed: ci ltar 'dod chags chags pa dang lhan cig gam chags pa med par yang 'grub pa med pa de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad kyang chos 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig gam lhan cig ma yin par yang 'grub pa med do /
translated: Just as attachment is not established as either simultaneous with or not simultaneous with one who is attached, so also all outer and inner phenomena such as anger and delusion are not established as either simultaneous with or not simultaneous with any phenomenon.

original: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par 'dod chags la sogs pa ma grub pas pha rol po dag gi rab tu byed pa'i dang por de dag la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don mağŸ”½grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par 'dod chags la sogs pa ma grub pas pha rol po dag gi rab tu byed pa'i dang por de dag la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since attachment and so on are not ultimately established in this way, the reason stated by the opponent in the first chapter, â€œIn dependence on them, the thorough afflictions and faults are taught,â€ is not established.

original: kun rdzob tu gtan tshigs nyid brjod @111a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gtan tshigs nyid brjod @111a * //
translated: The reason itself is stated conventionally.

original: na ni don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i
analyzed: na ni don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i
translated: â€œThe meaning is contradictoryâ€ means that the reason that the opponent uses to prove that the aggregates, elements, and faculties exist ultimately is the Buddhaâ€™s teaching that the afflictions and faults are based on them.

original: phyir ro zhes bya ba de de ltar don dam par 'dod chags la sogs pa ma grub pas gal te don dam par sgrub na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: phyir ro zhes bya ba de de ltar don dam par 'dod chags la sogs pa ma grub pas gal te don dam par sgrub na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: If you prove that they exist ultimately, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If you prove that they exist conventionally, the meaning is contradictory.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here the meaning of the chapter is that by stating the faults of the reason stated by the opponent, attachment and one who is attached are shown to be essenceless.

original: mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa drug pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol po dag phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag don dam par yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bcom ldan 'dasğŸ”½kyis de dag la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras ba de dag gi sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa drug pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol po dag phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag don dam par yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras ba de dag gi sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid
translated: In this sixth chapter, the examination of attachment and one who is attached, the meaning of the chapter is that the opponent asserts that the aggregates, elements and bases exist ultimately, because the Bhagavan taught that the afflictions and faults are based on them.

original: du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The faults of their proofs are stated in order to demonstrate that attachment, one who is attached and so on are all devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang chags pa la sogs pa la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re /
translated: In order to demonstrate what good qualities are possessed by the teaching that all phenomena, such as desire and the desirous one, are essenceless, and in order to demonstrate that this teaching that all phenomena, such as desire and the desirous one, are essenceless is the cause of the attainment of the state of omniscience, it says in the text: â€œThis is the cause of the attainment of omniscience.â€ğŸ”½

original: rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate what good qualities are possessed by the teaching that desire, one who desires, and so on, are realityless, and in order to dispel the claim of others that this teaching that desire, one who desires, and so on, are realityless is merely a dry treatise of sophistry, it is established here by means of a source of trustworthy scripture.

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' dag las /
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i mdo sde mtha' dag las /
translated: Therefore, in all the scriptures of the Mahayana,ğŸ”½it is said:

original: 'jam dpal 'dod chags med do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'dod chags med do //
translated: Manjusri, there is no desire.

original: 'dod chags su gdags pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags su gdags pa med do //
translated: There is no designation of desire.

original: zhe sdang med do //
analyzed: zhe sdang med do //
translated: There is no hatred.

original: zhe sdang du gdags pa med do //ğŸ”½gti mug med do //
analyzed: zhe sdang du gdags pa med do // gti mug med do //
translated: There is no designation of hatred.ğŸ”½There is no delusion.

original: gti mug tu gdags pa med do //ğŸ”½'dod chags ni byang chub po //
analyzed: gti mug tu gdags pa med do // 'dod chags ni byang chub po //
translated: There is no designation of delusion.ğŸ”½Desire is enlightenment.

original: zhe sdang ni byang chub po /
analyzed: zhe sdang ni byang chub po /
translated: Hatred is enlightenment.
